Ole signed this guy from Holland, an apparent creative, lively character, only to realise he has no idea of what to do with him. Ole signed a guy who had a few ok games for Palace and made him first choice, undroppable right back. Not realising and still not realising that he isn‚Äôt that good. Ole signed the most expensive defender in the world, failing to realise that he has a terrible CV for a reason and then made him captain. Ole signed Verane who has won everything and has made him look just as incompetent. Ole said when he first came in that the team would outrun the opposition and they now sit bottom of the running stats. Ole plays Fred and McTominay as 2 CDM when neither of them have been good enough from day one. Ole plays 2 CDM and says he is an attacking team with the Utd DNA. Ole has made Ronaldo look distinctively rubbish. Ole has not developed any player, either ones already there or ones he has bought. In fact, every player has regressed. Ole still sees a player in Pogba and we are just awaiting him being unleashed. Ole seems happy with Fernandes giving the ball away 95% of the time because he will eventually get one right. Ole has spent close to 500million quid and made the team worse. Ole‚Äôs cliches are a book in itself, awaiting the world‚Äôs most boring, predictable autobiograpghy. Ole‚Äôs mates still won‚Äôt say it how it is, despite being paid to be impartial. (scholes ex) Ole has been in charge of the worst period at Utd for over 30 years despite spending almost as much as his 3 predessors combined. Ole says his coaching staff are brilliant. Ole gave new contracts to Jones, Mata, Martial and probably a few others. He made De Gea the highest paid keeper in the world. Ole says he‚Äôs come too far and he is so close to achieving what he set out to do. Which is what exactly? Please tell us. Ole says winning trophies is not everything. I thought that was the whole point. Ole doesn‚Äôt park in his own space. Becasue he doesn‚Äôt have a wheel. Ole has no style of play, never has had, it‚Äôs a myth. Ole promotes youth, another myth. Name one? Ole yet again holds his hand up and says he made a mistake. After every game. Even though I feel the players are not anyway near as good as they are made out to be, that is Ole‚Äôs team, that is what he has put together in almost 3 years. I wouldn‚Äôt say that any player is safe when a decent, professional manager who knows what he is doing comes in. We cannot defend even the most basic of attacks, we have no midfield, we create nothing, we have no style, no fight, no grit, no determination, no flair. But Ole needs time? He‚Äôs had 3 years and we are no better than we were when he took over, I‚Äôd even say we are worse, no, we definatley are worse than we ever were under LVG and Maur. This result has been coming all season, with the exception of Leeds and Newcastle, we could have easily been beaten in every game. Quick note on Pogba being sent off, (stupid hair style for a grown ass man) yes it was a bad foul, yes it was very dangerous, reckless, ill-disciplined, stupid, naive, reckless. Not disputing the sending off. But can we just point out that it was yet another hospital ball from the messiah Fernandes. That sort of challenge has been waiting to happen for months. Terrible pass that was only going to end up one way. Why on earth they decided to give Ole a new contract in the summer is beyond me. Nobody was ever going to come along and tap him up, he was never going to turn any offer down. They could and should have waited until December, but decided to make him something like the 3rd highest paid manager in the league, which is now going to cost them millions when they eventually fire him. But we finsihed 2nd last season. So did Maurinho and you wanted him gone, plus, he actually won something. Mike (Just give him more time and few more 100 million, we might keep a clean sheet) United confusion United supporters, and indeed the club itself, are a very confused bunch. We‚Äôre so desperate to recreate the success and longevity of the Busby and Ferguson eras that we‚Äôre ignoring the real history of this club. For every Busby there have been multiple Frank O‚ÄôFarrells and Wilf McGuiness‚Äô. Without being realistic about Dave Sexton and Ron Atkinson there would never have been a Ferguson era. Evolution has to be honest; make the best decisions you can and then assess in an honest manner whether they worked or not. No trophies are handed out for who‚Äôs had the longest manager. For years we loved taking the piss out of Chelsea, and later City, for their attitudes towards binning managers ‚Äì because let‚Äôs face it, we could ‚Äì but in our desire to be different we‚Äôve lost sight of what‚Äôs most important, that circumstances dictate the decisions, not the other way around. The policy of treating our managers with respect and giving them resources and time is a good one, but the knowledge that we aren‚Äôt the sort of club who sacks title winning managers (or doubles in Ancelotti‚Äôs) case after one poor run or next shiny bauble in the background has to be enough. No club is best served pursuing the wrong course too long. Chris, MUFC. Fixtures forcing United action I genuinely believe that if Man Utd had a gentler run of fixtures to come after the game yesterday, there would still be plenty of support internally to let the Ole show run on and on and give him even more time to turn it around despite all the damning evidence against it. There are many who seem to think we‚Äôre in our ‚Äòta ra Fergie, 3 years of excuses and it‚Äôs still crap‚Äô moment, and it‚Äôs all about to magically come good and become *something*. What exactly? Who can tell! It‚Äôs only because the upcoming fixtures are so unappealing that their hands will be forced, whether it‚Äôs in the next day or so, or after Spurs, Man City or Chelsea. Ole can have no complaints, 3 years and the vast funds made available to him has given him far more patience to succeed than any other manager at a top level club would have enjoyed. This should have been the season Liverpool had after signing Alisson and VVD ‚Äì it is not. And this is really the problem ‚Äì it‚Äôs all knee jerk from the Man Utd hierarchy, floating from day to day trying to cobble something together. What will really be different in another week or another month? Bayern are really the super club Man Utd *should* have become. When they played in the 99‚Ä≤ final, they felt like similar clubs with similar histories and identities. Since then they have developed a culture based on their rich heritage and a ruthless desire to succeed, which has become bigger than any one person ‚Äì there is no SAF. Ex players are in significant positions at the club, but it‚Äôs all in the pursuit of building a relentless winning machine. It feels like Man Utd had aspirations of adopting that kind of model; I think that was the vision when this cycle started. It‚Äôs just been horribly, horribly executed. Bleak! Alex, Ipswich What are United ‚Äúclose‚Äù to? When asked if OGS was willing to resign his response was ‚ÄòWe are too close to give up now‚Äô. I was a bit confused by this following this season‚Äôs showing so decided to look it up in the old Oxford English‚Ä¶it states close means ‚Äòvery near to someone or something; with very little space between‚Äô. Firstly, I was surprised, that as we are 8 points behind league leaders Chelsea after only 9 games, I am unsure if that qualifies as ‚Äòclose‚Äô, at least from a quantitative standpoint. Given what I also experienced last night being ‚Äòutter dogsh#t‚Äô, and in fact worse than ANY football being played under his predecessors, I‚Äôm also unsure we can be considered ‚Äòclose‚Äô on a qualitative level also. The question then becomes ‚Äòwhat the F‚Ä¶‚Äô does Ole actually think we are close to, and does he expect another half billion to eke out that SMALL gap to City, Liverpool and Chelsea? #neverolein Dubai Red Where are the tactics? If there is one team in the EPL that consistently plays the same way, regardless of who comes into the team that day, over the 3 years OGS has been in charge of United, it‚Äôs Liverpool. City occasionally change things up ‚Äì Cancelo pushing into midfield last season or false 9‚Äôs when Aguero was out injured. Chelsea have been through a couple of managers, etc. But Liverpool play exactly the same way. So how can OGS and his coaching team set up and play so badly. Scholes saw how bad they were against Atalanta and prophesied exactly what was going to happen. It was that clear. So for Neville to continue defending the manager and coaching team to the hilt, was extraordinary. OGS had set them up with a 2 man midfield and they were going to press (if you can call it that) when they clearly hadn‚Äôt been coached how to do it properly or the players couldn‚Äôt be arsed to do it properly. I just can‚Äôt imagine they were doing this brilliantly in training and then failed on Sunday. But against Liverpool? Neville using the ‚ÄúUnited came second ahead of Liverpool and Chelsea last year‚Äù to defend his pal OGS is insane. It is clear that Fernandes has been the single positive impact since joining. And playing counter attacking football leveraging several fast forwards. Since bringing in Ronaldo they have changed the playing philosophy. Fernandes doesn‚Äôt have the same influence or impact (just as when he plays for Portugal), they have one less fast forward, Ronaldo shuffles around preserving energy waiting for an opportunity in the box. He is an amazing header of the ball but it is unsurprising he scores a higher percentage than on the ground now, as it means he doesn‚Äôt have to chase and run hard to get into position. He doesn‚Äôt bring other players into the game like Cavani either ‚Äì who would have been better to start yesterday. But the point the question is who is the most deluded? Neville or OGS. OGS saying the project Is close to coming together or Neville saying OGS is a good manager with a great snd experienced coaching team? How much does OGS think it‚Äôs going okay because of support from people like Neville snd Ferdinand? United have become the archetypical vanity project. Expensive players who think they are so good they only have to turn up to win. With teams playing to a system and with players who are willing to put in the graft to go with it, United are being left behind. How much further down will they go using the same tactics against more astute managers than OGS ( or Neville.) Paul McDevitt Formation change Man utd have been awful for the past games and watching them against Liverpool was heartbreaking.As a fan, I don‚Äôt understand the coach‚Äôs obsession with a 4-2-3-1 formation. I think solskjaer should change to 5-3-2 formation. Play Wanbisaka at the right of the defensive 3; Shaw and Dalot as wing backs; any 2 in the midfield with Bruno Fernandez/Sancho/Lingardinhio slightly ahead; Ronaldo and any of Rashford/Cavani/Greenwood up top. This would make us more compact and solid at the back and dangerous in the attack. It would also suit the counterattacking style of play he loves to play. I think Conte, if given the opportunity, would utilize this same system. Joel Z. Time to say goodbye Been very much #OleIn all along and been trying to cling to signs of growth but the last few games have shown he has done his job and has taken them as far as he can. Time to say thanks and goodbye as this result has been on the cards for a while. Whilst they would still have been miles off the signing of Ronaldo was always going to cause issues in some way or another and I‚Äôm sure it wont be long before the media leaks start. However, to my point, I heard someone make a very good point over the weekend about when he goes (it‚Äôs When not if now). He won‚Äôt resign due to being stubborn/proud (delete as applicable) so it will need the trigger being pulled. Woodward is due to leave at the end of the year and there is no way he will be the guy ‚Äòwho shot Bambi‚Äô So, he is here till January when the job will fall to Richard Arnold‚Ä¶and we all know he hasn‚Äôt been the same since GMTV (one for the morning TV crowd) Right back in to exile King Ralph (stayed till the end to avoid the Traffic) No need to gloat‚Ä¶ So I‚Äôm a Liverpool fan but I‚Äôm not here to gloat. No need. We were and are a superior TEAM. Have your expensive toys. They just go to waste on the bench anyway. Just to prove how Ole is out of his depth is the fact he took off your best player in the 1St half, Greenwood, and left on that Oldie Wan Kenobi ‚ÄòRonaldo‚Äô who was the icing on that pile of shite. I‚Äôve watched many comedies in my life. Only Fools and Horses, Arrested Development, Always Sunny in Philadelphia, Allo Allo. So many classics. But yesterday during United Liverpool someone should have told me they‚Äôd interrupt the program to show Benny Hill on the tear. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it was HILARIOUS! Who you ask? The most expensive CB in world is who! Harry ‚ÄòBenny Hill‚Äô Maguire. I mean he‚Äôs so bad it‚Äôs actually hilarious. I thought Djimi Traore was funny but Maguire has clearly said I said your shite defending son and raise you utter shite. Watch him for each first half goal. For the 1st, forget about it. Just standing like a tree in the middle of nowhere. For the second he actually tackles and pushes his own man. Brilliant. The 4th he‚Äôs busy trying to tackle Firmino but it‚Äôs a 10 year old kid kinda tackle. Just swinging at the ball he can‚Äôt reach üòÇüòÇ I love him. He cost more than Virgil. Beautiful. Any United fan that criticises City‚Äôs spending, well you really can‚Äôt talk. Btw Varane was never gonna be your rock. I‚Äôm also a Madrid supporter. He has been pants for years now. Benny Hill finally has his comedic partner. Alex (New York) Goal-poaching managers This might be true, it might not, but hey, everyone loves a theory, so here goes ‚Äì if there is one position on a football pitch that cannot, repeat cannot, ever go on to have a successful managerial career, it‚Äôs ‚Äògoal-poacher‚Äô. What is a goal poacher? Someone who reads the evolving currents of the game, notices its aura, how these two players are slotting together, how the midfield pivot is somehow off balance? It most certainly is not. It‚Äôs a player who, at a speed that would warp the mind of us non-pros, can spot that the weight their defender is shifted slightly the wrong way and so if they bend their run right this second . . goal. Goal for Van Nistelrooy, goal for Owen, Vardy. Goal for Solskjaer. Do you reckon that, if that was how they ‚Äòsaw‚Äô football, all their instincts tuned that way over twenty years or so ‚Äì they‚Äôd suddenly start to develop a deep, broader appreciation for it afterward? Or might they think things like ‚Äì Ronaldo, Greenwood, Rashford, Sancho, altogether? That‚Äôs four times as many goals! They‚Äôll figure out how with their own natural abilities! To be as frank as it requires ‚Äì Solskjaer being mentally fit to be an elite manager is like saying Michael Owen is mentally fit to be an elite analyst. It has always been thus ‚Äì the winning spell at the start was the demob-happy vibe of a team freed from Mourinho‚Äôs hateful reign; they played off that memory for a while. Now they‚Äôve forgotten. P.S Theory 2: until the cameras stop knee-jerk looking for Fergie at every game United will stay ‚Äòlike this‚Äô. best, Toby Sprigings Firmino resurgence Just a quick one on Firmino, what a resurgence over the last few weeks?! Last season was tricky to say the least (though his stats remained fairly consistent with previous years it just didn‚Äôt quite fire for him), and for a myriad of reasons, it was starting to look like his days as a first choice might be behind him. Given our absent defence/midfield, our pressing game was off, and we weren‚Äôt winning the ball back high up the pitch, which is where he flourishes. This season, with order restored to the rest of the team he looks sharp, he‚Äôs full of ideas, he‚Äôs confident and boy is it showing. Where I thought it would be Mane, Salah, Jota every week ‚Äì we currently have a real choice in there with Jota‚Äôs ability to play wide or in the middle. More than anything it will help manage fatigue and ensure Firmino and Jota have good minutes under their belts before AFCON. Lovely to see him back to his best. Just thought it was worth a mention. Cheers, Marc (London)

title: Berrettini alle sue seconde Atp Finals, 'nemmeno nei sogni'
description: Dopo certezza qualificazione: 'devo ricordare dove ho iniziato'
full_description: (ANSA) - ROMA, 26 OTT - "Non lo avevo neppure sognato, era qualcosa di troppo grande, ma ora sta accadendo, voglio fare del mio meglio". Cos√¨ Matteo Berrettini dopo la notizia della matematica qualificazione alle sue seconde Atp Finals (nel 2019 si qualific√≤ a Londra). La certezza di poter accedere al Palasport olimpico di Torino dal 14 al 21 novembre prossimi √® arrivata dopo il 7-6, 6-3 all'esordio nell'Atp 500 di Vienna e la contemporanea sconfitta al primo turno del polacco Hubert Hurkacz, battuto da Andy Murray. "Il 2020 √® stato un anno difficile per me, dentro e fuori dal campo. Qui sto per giocare la mia seconda Finals e non posso crederci. Devo sempre ricordare da dove ho iniziato", ha spiegato il 25enne romano. "Quando nel 2019 mi dissero che le Finals sarebbero state a Torino, ricordo che il sindaco della citt√† mi disse: 'Ci vediamo a Torino'. E io: 'S√¨, d'accordo'. Poi mi sono qualificato per Londra e ora mi sto qualificando per Torino. Non riesco proprio a descrivere quanto sono felice. Spero che il Paese sia orgoglioso di me". Berrettini si unisce al russo Andrey Rublev, al numero 1 al mondo Novak Djokovic, al campione degli Us Open Daniil Medvedev, al greco Stefanos Tsitsipas e al tedesco Alexander Zverev. Rimangono in palio due posti per le Finals: saranno aggiudicati nelle ultime tre settimane della stagione dell'Atp tour. Se li contendono Casper Ruud, Hubert Hurkacz, Jannik Sinner e Cameron Norrie. (ANSA).

content: Il presidente dell‚ÄôAssoAllenatori Renzo Ulivieri si √® inserito nella polemica contro gli arbitri e il Var Renzo Ulivieri, presidente dell‚ÄôAssociazione Italiana Arbitri, in una intervista al Corriere dello Sport difende la categoria arbitrale al centro di tante polemiche nelle ultime settimane. BUON MOMENTO ‚Äì ¬´Io sono un appassionato di arbitraggio. E vi dico che √® un buon momento. Il loro impegno √® quello di contribuire ad aumentare la qualit√† dello spettacolo. Come? Fischiando di meno, accettando il rischio del gioco in velocit√†. Se non voglio farlo, ho un modo classico e semplice: rallentare le partite, spezzettandole. Questo devono capirlo anche gli allenatori¬ª. VAR ‚Äì ¬´Corregge tanti errori. E quelli commessi dal VAR rappresentano una percentuale bassissima. A patto di non cascare nello sbaglio di frammentare l‚Äôazione, con ‚Äòlo tocca-non lo tocca‚Äô. Anche il videoarbitro deve restare un arbitro, nel cuore del gioco e del suo sviluppo¬ª. title: Mercato - PSG : Bonne nouvelle pour Leonardo avec... Zidane ?
description: Comme le10sport.com vous l'a r√©v√©l√© en exclusivit√©, le PSG r√™ve de Zinedine Zidane en cas de d√©part de Mauricio Pochettino. Toutefois, Manchester United penserait √©galement au Ballon d'Or 98 pour la‚Ä¶
full_description: Comme le10sport.com vous l'a r√©v√©l√© en exclusivit√©, le PSG r√™ve de Zinedine Zidane en cas de d√©part de Mauricio Pochettino. Toutefois, Manchester United penserait √©galement au Ballon d'Or 98 pour la succession d'Ole Gunnar Solskjaer. Mais heureusement pour le club de la capitale, les Red Devils n'auraient pas lanc√© les discussions avec Zinedine Zidane pour le moment. A la fin de la derni√®re saison, le nom de Mauricio Pochettino a √©t√© annonc√© sur le d√©part. Conscient de la situation, le PSG avait les id√©es claires concernant son entraineur argentin. Comme le10sport.com vous l'a r√©v√©l√© en exclusivit√©, la direction parisienne voulait conserver Mauricio Pochettino en priorit√©, mais ne comptait pas le retenir s'il d√©sirait partir. Et pour pallier le possible d√©part de son ancien joueur, le PSG - et plus pr√©cis√©ment les hautes sph√®res pr√©sentes √† Doha - r√™vait de recruter Zinedine Zidane. Un r√™ve qui existe encore, m√™me si Mauricio Pochettino est encore √† Paris, mais qui pourrait √™tre bris√© par Manchester United. En effet, les Red Devils penseraient au Ballon d'Or 98 pour remplacer Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, plus que jamais sur la sellette. Ce lundi soir, Alfredo Pedulla a fait un nouveau point sur l'avenir de Zinedine Zidane. Et √† en croire le journaliste de Sportitalia , la direction de Manchester United n'aurait pas encore boug√© ses pions pour le technicien fran√ßais. En effet, les Red Devils n'auraient pas lanc√© les contacts avec Zidane. Le PSG peut donc souffler, du moins pour le moment.

title: Licht gepikeerde Alonso hekelt de wederom 'inconsequente' FIA
creator: Marnik Kok
description: Tijdens de Grand Prix van de Verenigde Staten zag Fernando Alonso weer dat de FIA met twee maten meet tijdens de races. De Alpine-coureur werd volgens hem op illegale wijze ingehaald door Kimi Raikkonen, maar de Fin kreeg geen straf.
content: Op het Circuit of the Americas werd Fernando Alonso ingehaald door Kimi Raikkonen in bocht 1. Raikkonen nam een wijde lijn nadat Alonso zijn concurrent naar buiten dwong. De Alfa Romeo kwam in zijn geheel buiten de lijnen van het asfalt, wat officieel gezien leaving the track and gaining an advantage is. Toch kreeg Raikkonen geen straf van de FIA. Alonso is het er niet mee eens, en vindt niet dat Raikkonen geen keuze had nadat de Spanjaard hem naar buiten forceerde. "Er is hier natuurlijk een systeem voor, dus we moeten het maar accepteren", zegt hij tegen onder meer RacingNews365 . "Maar als je naar de hele race kijkt, weet ik het niet. Er waren soortgelijke incidenten" "Je forceert altijd iemand het circuit af als je aan de binnenkant van een bocht inremt", vervolgt Alonso, die uitlegt dat de track limits op deze manier erg lastig worden om te handhaven. "Als je iemand inhaalt en de ander zit aan de buitenkant, dan moeten ze op de rem trappen of juist vol gas gaan buiten de limiet van het asfalt. Dat is wat meerdere coureurs deden tijdens de race. Sainz deed het, Giovinazzi deed het en ik deed het. Wij moesten de posities ook weer teruggeven." Veel coureurs moesten hun positie dus teruggeven tijdens een dergelijk incident, maar Alonso benadrukt de inconsequente handelswijze van de FIA. "Kimi hoefde zijn plek niet terug te geven, ik vond dat niet consistent." Uiteindelijk kon Alonso leven met het incident, want later in de race viel hij uit met een probleem aan zijn achtervleugel. "Ik ben er niet te boos over, want het ging maar op een plekje voor √©√©n WK-punt. Bovendien ging de achtervleugel kapot, dus er veranderde in mijn race eigenlijk niets. Dus ja, het is voor nu niet echt een probleem."
full_description: Op het Circuit of the Americas werd Fernando Alonso ingehaald door Kimi Raikkonen in bocht 1. Raikkonen nam een wijde lijn nadat Alonso zijn concurrent naar buiten dwong. De Alfa Romeo kwam in zijn geheel buiten de lijnen van het asfalt, wat officieel gezien leaving the track and gaining an advantage is. Toch kreeg Raikkonen geen straf van de FIA. Alonso is het er niet mee eens, en vindt niet dat Raikkonen geen keuze had nadat de Spanjaard hem naar buiten forceerde. "Er is hier natuurlijk een systeem voor, dus we moeten het maar accepteren", zegt hij tegen onder meer RacingNews365 . "Maar als je naar de hele race kijkt, weet ik het niet. Er waren soortgelijke incidenten" "Je forceert altijd iemand het circuit af als je aan de binnenkant van een bocht inremt", vervolgt Alonso, die uitlegt dat de track limits op deze manier erg lastig worden om te handhaven. "Als je iemand inhaalt en de ander zit aan de buitenkant, dan moeten ze op de rem trappen of juist vol gas gaan buiten de limiet van het asfalt. Dat is wat meerdere coureurs deden tijdens de race. Sainz deed het, Giovinazzi deed het en ik deed het. Wij moesten de posities ook weer teruggeven." Veel coureurs moesten hun positie dus teruggeven tijdens een dergelijk incident, maar Alonso benadrukt de inconsequente handelswijze van de FIA. "Kimi hoefde zijn plek niet terug te geven, ik vond dat niet consistent." Uiteindelijk kon Alonso leven met het incident, want later in de race viel hij uit met een probleem aan zijn achtervleugel. "Ik ben er niet te boos over, want het ging maar op een plekje voor √©√©n WK-punt. Bovendien ging de achtervleugel kapot, dus er veranderde in mijn race eigenlijk niets. Dus ja, het is voor nu niet echt een probleem."

title: T20 World Cup: Hardik Pandya's shoulder injury "not serious" but team management will "wait and watch"
description: Flamboyant India all-rounder Hardik Pandya's shoulder injury sustained during the T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan is believed to be a minor one and he is likely to be available for the next game against New Zealand on October 31.
full_description: Flamboyant India all-rounder 's shoulder injury sustained during the T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan is believed to be a minor one and he is likely to be available for the next game against New Zealand on October 31. Pandya, who did not bowl in the last month, is playing only as a batter right now and scored 11 off 8 balls on Sunday night, looking distinctly uncomfortable against pacers before being hit on the shoulder by a short ball. "Yes, Hardik's scan reports have come and the injury is not very serious. Also the fact that there is a six-day gap between two games gives him enough time to recuperate," a senior BCCI official told PTI on conditions of anonymity. "But obviously, the medical team would wait and watch as to how he shapes up during the training sessions," he added. Pandya had recently said that he would be bowling during the knock-out stages but India's chances hinge on the New Zealand game. Losing the match would seriously jeopardise their prospects of going ahead in the tournament. The games against Scotland, Namibia and Afghanistan are expected to be easy wins for India, Pakistan and New Zealand. Therefore, if India lose to New Zealand, it will hamper their chances of making it to the top two in the group. In this scenario, Pandya's fitness issues have seriously affected India's balance. In fact, there are questions being raised about chairman of selectors Chetan Sharma assertions that Pandya will be bowling in the IPL to gear up for the World Cup. He didn't bowl an over and the communication on Pandya's fitness status between the team management and selectors seems baffling at this time. There have been conflicting reports about when he would start bowling. Before the Pakistan game, the player said that he would perhaps bowl in the knock-outs but the statement did not look convincing.

full_description: A dicembre si giocher√† al Maradona Cup: si sfideranno Barcellona e Boca Juniors, assente il Napoli messo sotto accusa in Argentina Tra quattro giorni sar√† il suo compleanno, tra un mese far√† un anno dalla sua morte. title: Percat completes Walkinshaw Andretti United line-up
description: The four-time Supercars race winner has long been linked to a sensational return to the Walkinshaw fold in place of outgoing WAU driver Bryce Fullwood.That's now been made official, WAU today confirming that Percat will partner Mostert in an all-star line-up for 2022 and beyond.Percat has a long history with the Clayton squad, having carried Walkinshaw support back when he was racing ...Keep reading
full_description: The four-time Supercars race winner has long been linked to a sensational return to the Walkinshaw fold in place of outgoing WAU driver Bryce Fullwood . That's now been made official, WAU today confirming that Percat will partner Mostert in an all-star line-up for 2022 and beyond. Percat has a long history with the Clayton squad, having carried Walkinshaw support back when he was racing Formula Ford in the late 2000s. He then drove for the team in Super2 in the early 2010s, and took a remarkable Bathurst 1000 win as a rookie alongside Garth Tander for the Walkinshaw-run Holden Racing Team in 2011. The Tander/Percat Holden Commodore is now owned by WAU part-owner Zak Brown. In 2014 Percat completed a single full main game season in a fourth Walkinshaw entry before parting ways with the organisation to join LD Motorsport the following year. He has now been wooed back to Clayton to partner Mostert following his somewhat unexpected split with Brad Jones Racing just weeks after announcing a new deal. ‚ÄúI am extremely excited and grateful to be joining Walkinshaw Andretti United . Having been with the Walkinshaw family during my junior days in Formula Ford and Super2 this is where I feel at home," said Percat. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve dreamt of having my name next to the #2 from a very young age and now for it to be reality is amazing. I cannot wait to repay the faith to the team, especially Ryan and Martine [Walkinshaw]. "The Walkinshaw family has been a huge part of my career since 2007. ‚ÄúDriving alongside Chaz is something I am really looking forward to, he is undoubtedly one of the fastest guys on the grid. We spent a lot of time racing against each other since Formula Ford so now I‚Äôm excited to be joining forces with him as we work together to continue the team‚Äôs progression to the front of the grid.‚Äù Ryan Walkinshaw added: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fantastic to have Nick back with our team. Nick and my family share a great history together, and I‚Äôm excited at the opportunity to add to that going forward. ‚ÄúWe saw what a talent Nick was from a young age, working with him as he climbed the ranks into a main game driver and a Bathurst winner, and now to have him back home is really fitting. "He‚Äôs a fantastic driver, and his performances prove he belongs in the conversation of the top drivers in the category." Bryce Fullwood, Walkinshaw Andretti United Holden Photo by: Mark Horsburgh, Edge Photographics The Percat deal marks a straight swap with Fullwood, who is headed to BJR for the 2022 season. With Matt Stone Racing having announced its completed line-up earlier today, Jack Le Brocq to join Todd Hazelwood , the 2022 grid is now effectively locked in. Two of the three spots yet to be made official are at BJR, although Macauley Jones and Jack Smith are expected to partner newcomers Andre Heimgartner and Jack Smith . The other is at Kelly Grove Racing , which is waiting on a Superlicence exemption for Kiwi teenager Matt Payne. The 2022 Supercars drivers Blanchard Racing Team Tim Slade Tickford Racing Cameron Waters James Courtney Jake Kostecki Thomas Randle Dick Johnson Racing Anton De Pasquale Will Davison Kelly Grove Racing David Reynolds Matt Payne* Brad Jones Racing Andre Heimgartner Bryce Fullwood Macauley Jones * Jack Smith* Erebus Motorsport Will Brown Brodie Kostecki Team 18 Mark Winterbottom Scott Pye Team Sydney Fabian Coulthard Garry Jacobson Walkinshaw Andretti United Chaz Mostert Nick Percat Matt Stone Racing Todd Hazelwood Jack Le Brocq Triple Eight Race Engineering Broc Feeney Shane van Gisbergen *TBC shares comments

title: Bastianini ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt confident‚Äù of Misano MotoGP podium return
description: Bastianini claimed his maiden MotoGP podium five weeks ago when MotoGP last visited Misano for the San Marino GP having come from 12th on the grid.A repeat looked unlikely after he suffered three crashes on Saturday and qualified down in 16th.However, the 2020 Moto2 world champion once again climbed up the order and capitalised on high attrition to snatch third away from Yamaha‚Äôs Fabio ...Keep reading
full_description: Bastianini claimed his maiden MotoGP podium five weeks ago when MotoGP last visited Misano for the San Marino GP having come from 12th on the grid. A repeat looked unlikely after he suffered three crashes on Saturday and qualified down in 16th. However, the 2020 Moto2 world champion once again climbed up the order and capitalised on high attrition to snatch third away from Yamaha‚Äôs Fabio Quartararo on the final lap. ‚ÄúYes, it stayed a very difficult weekend for me,‚Äù Bastianini said after the race. ‚ÄúYesterday I destroyed three bikes in eight laps, and today I wasn‚Äôt confident to arrive on the podium. ‚ÄúBut after many laps during the race I saw my pace and it was really close to the first group with Marc [Marquez] and Pecco [Bagnaia]. ‚ÄúThe last 10 laps I pushed a lot to recover some positions and in the end I was in fourth place. ‚ÄúAlso, I saw Fabio very close to me and in the last lap I pushed all to recover to him and I passed Fabio at the Caro [hairpin]. ‚ÄúAlso, I want to say thanks to my team because they did a very, very good job yesterday and also today. ‚ÄúThe battle with Fabio was very strange because he was battling for the title and in the end won. ‚ÄúBut inside me I thought only I wanted to arrive in third place because I was very close to him. I stayed polished in my overtaking, so I‚Äôm happy.‚Äù Enea Bastianini, Esponsorama Racing Photo by: Gold and Goose / Motorsport Images This marked Bastianini‚Äôs fourth-successive top six result of his rookie campaign, but insists he must improve his qualifying results having started the last four rounds ninth, 12th and 16th. ‚ÄúI think the qualifying because every time I start from ninth to 16th,‚Äù he replied when asked what he needs to improve going forward. Read Also: Mir‚Äôs Misano MotoGP jump start due to launch control confusion The three factors that crowned MotoGP‚Äôs newest champion at Misano ‚ÄúThis is not good for the race because I have to do a lot of overtaking. ‚ÄúI think we have to work also on the Saturday in FP4 to do more laps consecutively because always I did short runs. Now we study what we can do for the next races.‚Äù shares comments

title: Zinedine Zidane 'not interested in Manchester United job'
description: Former Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane reportedly has no interest in replacing Ole Gunnar Solskjaer as Manchester United manager.
full_description: On the back of the 5-0 reverse against Liverpool on Sunday, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer 's long-term future at Old Trafford has been left up in the air. While the Norwegian has categorically insisted that he will not resign, speculation persists that United's owners may opt to make a replacement. However, according to reports in Spain , Zidane does not want to be considered as an alternative in the United dugout for the foreseeable future. The former Real Madrid boss, who has been out of a job since the summer, is said to be content with taking a sabbatical before deciding on his next role. The report adds that only an opportunity at Paris Saint-Germain or with France would peak Zidane's interest in the short term.

title: Lovlina, Shiva Thapa In Contention For Place In AIBA Athletes Committee
description: Olympic bronze-winner Lovlina Borgohain and five-time Asian medallist Shiva Thapa are in contention to be Asia's representatives in the International Boxing Association's (AIBA) athletes committee.
full_description: Olympic bronze-winner Lovlina Borgohain and five-time Asian medallist Shiva Thapa are in contention to be Asia's representatives in the International Boxing Association's (AIBA) athletes committee, which will be formed through voting during the world championships for men and women. The men's showpiece is currently in progress in Belgrade, where Thapa is competing in the 63.5kg category. The Assam boxer is a former bronze-winner at the event. The women's event is planned for December in Turkey and Borgohain will compete there after being picked for the squad on the basis of her Tokyo Olympics performance. She has previously won two bronze medals in the marquee tournament. AIBA received 34 nominations from five confederations, of which 27 were found to be eligible by its ethics committee. If any of the two Indians is elected, it would ensure the country's presence in the panel for a second successive time after veteran L Sarita Devi, a former world champion, made it unopposed in 2019 during the tenure of interim president Mohamed Moustahsane. The Asian bloc's contenders include three women and four men. Borgohain will be challenged by North Korea's Pang Chol Mih, a former world champion and two-time Asian-medallist, and Kazakhstan's Nayzm Kyzaibay, a two-time world champion and the reigning Asian gold-medallist. Thapa will be up against reigning Olympic champion Bakhodir Jalolov of Uzbekistan, Pakistan's Awais Ali Khan, and Kazakhstan's Ablaikhan Zhussupov, a two-time world and Asian Championships medal winner. "The Athletes Committee will be composed of 10 people, with the newly-elected Chair and Vice-Chair becoming voting members of the AIBA Board of Directors," the AIBA stated. One male and one female member from each confederation will be elected by the registered boxers who are/will be in attendance at the world championships. "Each election shall be conducted by a secret ballot. AIBA shall decide if electronic or paper ballots shall be used," the world body said. The term of office of the athletes committee members will be until the 2025 World Championships, a much longer run than what the previous panel got. During their term, the members of the Committee would expected to work to ensure that the views and opinions of boxers are represented within AIBA. "One of the tasks of the new members of the Committee will be working with and supporting AIBA's mission to develop and promote the sport of boxing everywhere," AIBA President Umar Kremlev said. Promoted "Considering the challenges we are overcoming at the moment, we truly need people who are ready to fight for a brighter future of our beloved sport. And who can fight better than boxers themselves?," he said. "At AIBA, we value everyone's input in our reforms. In the end, all of our work is on behalf of boxers and those who support them. So it is vital for us to hear what the boxers have to say," he added.

title: TSV Pentenried: M√∂hwald kritisiert Dreierpacker Moritz Lang mit Augenzwinkern
creator: Tobias Empl
description: Moritz Langer ist der Spieler des Spieltags im W√ºrmtal. Gegen den SC Maisach II traf er f√ºr den TSV Pentenried dreimal ins Schwarze - in einer Halbzeit.
full_description: Moritz Langer ist der Spieler des Spieltags im W√ºrmtal. Gegen den SC Maisach II traf er f√ºr den TSV Pentenried dreimal ins Schwarze - in einer Halbzeit. Pentenried ‚Äì Drei Tore in einer Halbzeit sind f√ºr keinen Fu√üballer allt√§glich. Moritz Langer gelang dieses Kunstst√ºck am Sonntag beim 5:2-Erfolg des TSV Pentenried im Ausw√§rtsspiel gegen den SC Maisach II. Dabei hatte der Pentenrieder Angreifer zuvor wochenlang √ºberhaupt nicht getroffen. ‚ÄûIch habe ihm immer vertraut und wusste, dass irgendwann der Knoten platzt‚Äú, sagt TSV-Trainer Franz M√∂hwald. ‚ÄûEr h√§tte in der zweiten Halbzeit noch drei Tore schie√üen k√∂nnen ‚Äì aber da war er dann ein bisschen entspannt.‚Äú Zum Platzen des Knotens trug m√∂glicherweise auch bei, dass der Trainer seinen Sch√ºtzling diesmal nicht als Mittelst√ºrmer aufstellte, sondern ihn auf die Au√üenbahn beorderte. Von dort aus zog Langer nach sechs Minuten mit Tempo nach innen und traf aus gut 20 Metern zum 1:1 f√ºr die fr√ºh in R√ºckstand geratenen Pentenrieder. Nach dem erneuten R√ºckstand (38.) konterte Langer umgehend, diesmal verwertete er eine Flanke von Vinzent Wukonigg per Direktabnahme. Beinahe mit dem Pausenpfiff legte er per Abstauber seinen dritten Treffer nach. F√ºr Trainer M√∂hwald hatte sich Langer diese Erfolgserlebnisse auf jeden Fall verdient. Er sei ein ‚Äûsehr mannschaftsdienlicher Spieler‚Äú, der auch neben dem Platz stets vorne dabei sei, wenn es darum gehe, sich in den Dienst des Teams zu stellen ‚Äì ob beim Flaschentragen oder beim Aufpumpen der B√§lle. Nur eines wirft M√∂hwald Langer vor: ‚ÄûEr h√§tte in der zweiten Halbzeit noch drei Tore schie√üen k√∂nnen ‚Äì aber da war er dann ein bisschen entspannt.‚Äú (te)

title: Horner: "Chuck the form book away" in F1 title run-in
description: Red Bull and Max Verstappen are widely regarded as favourites for the event, with the Dutchman having won in 2017 and 2018 and been fastest in qualifying in 2019 before he received a grid penalty.However, after Verstappen won last weekend‚Äôs US GP in Austin ‚Äì a track usually associated with success for Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes ‚Äì¬†Horner¬†says it‚Äôs impossible to predict which ...Keep reading
full_description: Red Bull and Max Verstappen are widely regarded as favourites for the event, with the Dutchman having won in 2017 and 2018 and been fastest in qualifying in 2019 before he received a grid penalty. However, after Verstappen won last weekend‚Äôs US GP in Austin ‚Äì a track usually associated with success for Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes ‚Äì Horner says it‚Äôs impossible to predict which of the title contenders will have the upper hand. "I think you've got to chuck the form book away,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt's very tight between the two teams. Mexico has been a good track for us, but it's been a good track for them as well, on occasion. So we don't underestimate them.‚Äù Horner stressed that the Austin success was significant for his team: "They are all important, but this is a big one, because this has been such a stronghold of Lewis and Mercedes. ‚ÄúSo to get the pole was a landmark moment for us, and then to convert into a win, even not leading on the first lap.‚Äù He added that the team cannot become too confident, despite the Austin result extending Verstappen‚Äôs lead. ‚ÄúYou've got to attack. So 12 points is nothing, it can disappear very, very quickly, as we've seen previously. ‚ÄúSo we've got to keep attacking race weekends and get the most out of them that we possibly can. And five to go, the pressure only gets bigger." Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB16B Photo by: Zak Mauger / Motorsport Images Mercedes trackside engineering director Andrew Shovlin admitted that the world champions expect a tough fight with Red Bull in Mexico. ‚ÄúIf you look ahead to Mexico, that is a track in the past that has suited them and has suited the Honda power unit,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut regardless of that we‚Äôve still got to arrive with a car that is performing at the best of the car‚Äôs ability, and give a car to Lewis and Valtteri [Bottas] that allows them to do their best job. ‚ÄúThat is the only thing we are working on, we are not really worrying about where Red Bull are." Asked if Mercedes could surprise Red Bull in Mexico, Shovlin said: ‚ÄúHonestly, if we can take the race to them like we did today that is probably the best case scenario that we can envisage. ‚ÄúThere is a lot to do, and it is such a different circuit, and such a different environment for the power unit to operate in. ‚ÄúBut there have not been many circuits where we have been far off the pace. We have struggled in Monaco, we were struggling in Baku and we struggled a bit in the second Austria, but there are more of them where we can challenge and we can challenge for pole. ‚ÄúAs I said we know we‚Äôve struggled there in the past, and we know what we need to be working on in the next week or so, and that is what we will get stuck into.‚Äù shares comments

title: Fix: Honda in SBK-WM 2022 mit Lecuona und Vierge
description: Was regelm√§√üige Leser von SPEEDWEEK.com bereits l√§nger wissen, wurde nun von Honda best√§tigt. In der Superbike-WM 2022 tritt Honda mit Iker Lecuona and Xavi Vierge an.
full_description: Nun ist es offiziell: Das Werksteam der Honda Racing Corporation wird in der Superbike-WM 2022 mit zwei neuen Piloten antreten. Denn nachdem Alvaro Bautista f√ºr die Superbike-WM 2022 zum Aruba.it Ducati-Werksteam zur√ºckkehrt wurde vor wenigen Minuten best√§tigt, dass die Zusammenarbeit mit Leon Haslam mit dem Saisonfinale in Indonesien endet. Gleichzeitig best√§tigte Honda sein Fahrer-Duo f√ºr die kommende Saison. Mit Iker Lecuona und Xavi Vierge nimmt der weltgr√∂√üte Motorradhersteller nicht nur eine drastische Verj√ºngungskur vor, sondern setzt auch auf zwei, die noch nie ein Superbike fuhren, die Pirelli-Reifen und auch einige Strecken nicht kennen. Beide sind seit vielen Jahren auf Prototypen unterwegs. Lecuona ist seit 2016 im Grand-Prix-Paddock. Zuerst fuhr er vier Jahre in der Moto2-Klasse, 2020 und dieses Jahr ist er beim MotoGP-Team Tech 3 KTM unter Vertrag. Seine Statistik beeindruckt wenig: In bislang 82 Grands Prix schaffte er es nur zweimal aufs Podium: als Zweiter und Dritter in der Moto2-WM. Eine Weltmeisterschaft beendete er nie besser als auf dem zw√∂lften Platz, 2018 und 2019 in Moto2. Dass der 21-J√§hrige √ºber Talent mit gro√üen Bikes verf√ºgt, beweist er in diesem Jahr: Dreimal preschte er auf der KTM RC16 in die Top-10 und brillierte als Sechster im Nassen auf dem Red Bull Ring und als Siebter im Trockenen in Silverstone. Vierge f√§hrt seit 2015 in der Moto2-WM, holte vier Podestpl√§tze, aber keinen Sieg. Sein bestes Ergebnis in der laufenden Saison eroberte er als Dritter auf seiner Heimstrecke in Barcelona, in der Gesamtwertung liegt der 24-J√§hrige auf Rang 10. Das ist auch seine bislang beste Platzierung in der Weltmeisterschaft.

title: AKS Z≈Çy zmierzy siƒô z FC United of Manchester w nowych europejskich rozgrywkach
content: Ju≈º w najbli≈ºszƒÖ ≈õrodƒô 27 pa≈∫dziernika AKS Z≈Çy zmierzy siƒô z FC United of Manchester w w turnieju klub√≥w amatorskich Fenix Trophy, czyli najnowszych europejskich rozgrywkach pucharowych. Dalsza czƒô≈õƒá tekstu znajduje siƒô pod materia≈Çem wideo W tym roku polski klub znalaz≈Ç siƒô w elitarnym gronie o≈õmiu europejskich zespo≈Ç√≥w, kt√≥re zagrajƒÖ w turnieju klub√≥w amatorskich Fenix Trophy, czyli najnowszych europejskich rozgrywkach pucharowych. W swoim drugim meczu Polacy zmierzƒÖ siƒô z angielskim FC United of Manchester. Zosta≈Ç on za≈Ço≈ºony 21 czerwca 2005 r. przez 2500 kibic√≥w Manchesteru United , kt√≥rzy strajkowali przeciwko przejƒôciu MU przez ameryka≈Ñskiego miliardera Malcolma Glazera. Jest on najwiƒôkszym na ≈õwiecie klubem, kt√≥ry znajduje siƒô w rƒôkach kibic√≥w. Fenix Trophy to turniej klub√≥w amatorskich, do udzia≈Çu w kt√≥rym zaproszono osiem dru≈ºyn (ka≈ºdy wsp√≥lnie z partnerskƒÖ organizacjƒÖ charytatywnƒÖ) z ca≈Çej Europy. Wytypowane dru≈ºyny reprezentujƒÖ siedem kraj√≥w: Polskƒô, Niemcy, Hiszpaniƒô, W≈Çochy, Niemcy, Holandiƒô, WielkƒÖ Brytaniƒô oraz Czechy. Uczestnicy nowych rozgrywek zostali podzieleni na dwie grupy i rywalizacja odbywa siƒô w systemie "mecz i rewan≈º". AKS Z≈Çy trafi≈Ç do grupy B, razem z BrerƒÖ FC Mediolan, FC United of Manchester oraz holenderskim Afc DWS Amsterdam. W grupie A znalaz≈Çy siƒô natomiast AS Lodigiani 1972 (W≈Çochy), HFC Falke e.V. Hamburg (Niemcy), Prague Raptors Football Club (Czechy) i Cuenca-Mestallistes 1925 (Hiszpania). Polski zesp√≥≈Ç przegra≈Ç w historycznym, inauguracyjnym meczu z w≈Çoskim Brera FC 1:2. W fundamentach ideowych klubu zapisane sƒÖ r√≥wno≈õƒá, akceptacja r√≥≈ºnorodno≈õci i wzajemny szacunek. Kibice Z≈Çego wyr√≥≈ºniajƒÖ siƒô na tle wielu fan√≥w, kt√≥rych mo≈ºna spotka≈Ñ na trybunach podczas mecz√≥w Ekstraklasy czy I Ligi, poniewa≈º chocia≈º ≈õpiewajƒÖ g≈Ço≈õno i z pasjƒÖ, to jednak zawsze kulturalnie. Nigdy nie obra≈ºajƒÖ rywali, sƒôdzi√≥w czy kibic√≥w dru≈ºyn przeciwnych. Miƒôdzy innymi z tego powodu UEFA nagrodzi≈Ça dwa lata temu AKS jako najlepszy amatorski klub pi≈Çkarski w Europie. Spotkanie AKS Z≈Çy - FC United of Manchester odbƒôdzie siƒô w ≈õrodƒô 27 pa≈∫dziernika o godzinie 19:45. Mecz zostanie rozegrany na tym samym obiekcie, co starcie z W≈Çochami.

title: Skandaliczne zachowanie na GP USA. "Mogliby siƒô nauczyƒá szacunku"

Raperka powinna mieƒá ≈õwiadomo≈õƒá, ≈ºe pojawiajƒÖc siƒô w tym miejscu mo≈ºe zostaƒá poproszona o wywiad. Wiƒôcej tre≈õci sportowych znajdziesz te≈º na Gazeta.pl . "Czu≈Çem siƒô ju≈º pod presjƒÖ gwiazd na polach startowych, ale mia≈Ço to miejsce, gdy stali na nich Senna, Prost, Schumacher, Mansell, Piquet i inni. Ochroniarze w tym miejscu mi nie przeszkadzajƒÖ, bo ka≈ºdy ma robotƒô do wykonania. Mogliby siƒô jednak nauczyƒá manier i szacunku do innych os√≥b, kt√≥re wykonujƒÖ pracƒô w F1" - opisa≈Ç ca≈Çe zaj≈õcie Brundle na Twitterze. "Ochroniarze nie majƒÖ absolutnie ≈ºadnego miejsca w F1 i, szczerze m√≥wiƒÖc, celebryci te≈º, kt√≥rzy sƒÖ tam dla w≈Çasnej reklamy, ale nie chcƒÖ rozmawiaƒá z mediami. Ci, kt√≥rzy po≈õwiƒôcajƒÖ czas na rozmowƒô z mediami i dzielƒÖ siƒô swoim entuzjazmem, sƒÖ mile widziani" - odpisa≈Ç jeden z internaut√≥w. Verstappen pokaza≈Ç Hamiltonowi ≈õrodkowy palec. Martin Brundle pr√≥bowa≈Ç r√≥wnie≈º przeprowadziƒá rozmowƒô z SerenƒÖ Williams na temat zbli≈ºajƒÖcego siƒô wy≈õcigu. Znakomita tenisistka kompletnie jednak go zignorowa≈Ça.

title: Fonseca overtaken as Newcastle enter ‚Äòdecisive‚Äô talks with new first choice
creator: Samuel Bannister
description: An appointment is expected by the end of the week and reports in Germany claim there is a new order on the wish-list The post Fonseca overtaken as Newcastle enter ‚Äòdecisive‚Äô talks with new first choice appeared first on TEAMtalk.
content: A new favourite has emerged in the running to become the next manager of Newcastle United, according to reports. Steve Bruce was recently dismissed by Newcastle‚Äôs wealthy new owners, who are now looking for his replacement. Graeme Jones has overseen one of the two games he will spend as their interim manager. A permanent replacement, therefore, should be on the horizon. To date, the favourite has been thought to be Paulo Fonseca. After negotiations with Tottenham Hotspur collapsed over the summer, the former Roma boss could get another chance to move into the Premier League. Fonseca reportedly impressed Amanda Staveley in an interview. Therefore, he has seemed likely to take over at St James‚Äô Park. However, there has now been a twist. According to Bild, Lucien Favre has jumped to the front of the queue to fill the vacancy. Favre most recently managed Borussia Dortmund between 2018 and 2020. Over the summer, he was under consideration by Crystal Palace, but he had a change of heart and decided not to take the job. Like Fonseca, though, that hasn‚Äôt necessarily closed the door to him taking a different Premier League job. Newcastle are now said to be in talks with Favre, which have reached a ‚Äúdecisive‚Äù stage. Fonseca has, for now, been relegated to ‚Äúsecond choice‚Äù. Bild expect the new manager to be presented by the end of the week. They are confident it could be Favre. Favre ready for new challenge The Swiss coach, 63, has enjoyed a lengthy career in football. During his playing days, he was capped 24 times by his national team. Since 1993, he has been working from the other side of the touchline. His first job in management was with Echallens, whom he led to promotion at the first time of asking. He has since gone on to represent the likes of FC Zurich, Hertha Berlin and Nice. His longest tenure in a job was the four years he spent in charge of Borussia Monchengladbach between February 2011 and September 2015. Favre has won trophies with Servette (the 2000-01 Swiss Cup), Zurich (back-to-back Swiss league titles in 2006 and 2007 after cup success in 2005) and Dortmund (the 2019 DFL-Supercup). The latter job was his most successful in terms of the points per game he accumulated. At the time of his exit, he was also the Dortmund coach with the best ever point average. He won 68 of his 110 matches in charge, but it all came to an end when he lost 5-1 to Stuttgart in December 2020. Favre has been waiting for the right opportunity since and it seems Newcastle may provide him with the next platform. It would be his first job in the Premier League and the fourth different country he has managed in after Switzerland, Germany and France. full_description: Bremen ‚Äì Er war weg, ist wieder da und doch noch nicht dabei: Auf Kapit√§n und Abwehrchef √ñmer Toprak muss Werder Bremen weiter auf unbestimmte Zeit warten. Nachdem der 32-J√§hrige seine Wadenverletzung einige Zeit in Leverkusen hatte behandeln lassen, setzt er sein Reha-Programm zwar seit wenigen Tagen wieder in Bremen fort, doch dass er deshalb an der Schwelle zum Comeback steht, ist eine falsche Interpretation der Situation, sagt √ñmer Toprak . Zwar habe die medizinische Abteilung einen Fahrplan erstellt, um ihn wieder spielfit zu bekommen, ‚Äûaber zu sagen, an diesem oder jenem Tag bin ich zur√ºck, das habe ich mir abgew√∂hnt‚Äú, erkl√§rt er im ‚ÄûStrom-Talk‚Äú des SV Werder Bremen . Werder Bremens Kapit√§n √ñmer Toprak kann keine Prognose f√ºr Comeback geben Also: keine Prognose. Dabei gehe es der Wade ‚Äûganz gut‚Äú, so Toprak: ‚ÄûAber weil ich lange gefehlt habe, geht es jetzt erstmal darum, wieder Kondition und Fitness aufzubauen.‚Äú Nach sechs Wochen Auszeit muss das sein. An der eigenen Ungeduld √§ndert das aber nichts. √ñmer Toprak , der die zur√ºckliegenden, wenig erfolgreichen Ausw√§rtsspiele des SV Werder Bremen in Darmstadt (0:3) und Sandhausen (2:2) ‚Äûzu Hause und allein vor dem Fernseher‚Äú verfolgt hat, h√§lt es nach eigener Aussage kaum noch aus, tatenlos zusehen zu m√ºssen. ‚ÄûIch bin ein schwieriger Verletzter. Wenn die Ergebnisse so sind, wie sie sind, bin ich sehr sauer‚Äú, sagt er. Sein Eindruck nach den letzten Partien: ‚ÄûIch habe ich das Gef√ºhl, dass die Jungs mich brauchen. Aber leider kann ich nur von au√üen Hilfestellung geben.‚Äú (csa) Lest dazu: R√§nge in Rage: Wie Werder mit der zunehmenden Fan-Kritik umgeht !

content: RAFA BENITEZ is Newcastle‚Äôs ‚Äòdream‚Äô successor to Steve Bruce. But the Spaniard will be difficult to prise from Everton. He next managed Dalian Professional in China, before returning to the Premier League at Goodison Park in the summer. His appointment was met with fury by loyal Evertonians, who were against hiring a former Liverpool manager. But owner Farhad Moshiri ignored the concerns of supporters and hired his man anyway. title: Liverpool have just dropped a major hint about Jurgen Klopp's squad to face Preston tomorrow
creator: Olly Dawes
description: Liverpool take on Preston North End in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday night and may have dropped a big hint about their team selection for... The post Liverpool have just dropped a major hint about Jurgen Klopp's squad to face Preston tomorrow appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC/Liverpool FC via Getty Images Liverpool take on Preston North End in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday night and may have dropped a big hint about their team selection for the game. The Reds beat Manchester United 5-0 on Sunday to seal a dream eight days, picking up a win over Atletico Madrid and hammering Watford too. Now, the attention turns to the Carabao Cup and a short trip to Lancashire to take on Championship side Preston. North End aren‚Äôt faring well in the Championship right now and that may give Liverpool a chance to blood some young players. If Liverpool fans needed a hint in that direction, last night‚Äôs Under-23 game gave it. Liverpool teenagers left out ahead of Preston trip Liverpool took on Blackburn Rovers in Premier League 2 on Monday night, but they named a team lacking some key players. Conor Bradley, James Balagizi, Mateusz Musialowski, Kaide Gordon and Tyler Morton were all left out of the Liverpool side last night. Photo by Stephen Pond/Getty Images That‚Äôs a major hit that all five players will be involved in Jurgen Klopp‚Äôs Liverpool squad against Preston on Wednesday. Bradley and Gordon started in the last round against Norwich City, with Balagizi and Morton now on the bench for that game. Musialowski could now join in with Liverpool looking to give their young players a chance at Deepdale. Photo by Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC/Liverpool FC via Getty Images The post Liverpool have just dropped a major hint about Jurgen Klopp's squad to face Preston tomorrow appeared first on HITC.

title: 2021 Max is unlike anything Hamilton has faced
creator: Oliver Harden
description: There comes a point in a driver's career when, oozing so much speed and self-confidence, they begin to have the look and feel of a champion. The post 2021 Max is unlike anything Hamilton has faced appeared first on PlanetF1.
content: There comes a point in a Formula One driver‚Äôs career when, oozing so much speed and self-confidence, they begin to have the look and feel of a World Champion. For Max Verstappen, that day came at the Dutch Grand Prix at the start of September. Max had performed in front of large and expectant crowds before, of course, winning at Red Bull‚Äôs own circuit in Austria a total of four times (twice in 2021) and securing a victory of sorts in his second home race at Spa the previous weekend. But Zandvoort felt different. This, after all, was the race always meant to revolve around him and one that only existed because of him, the event the Dutch fans and their devotion to Verstappen had deserved since his F1 debut in 2015. The compact and high-downforce nature of Suzuka‚Äôs younger sibling favoured Red Bull, no doubt, but there was still a job to be done and plenty of potential ‚Äì with Verstappen embarking upon the climb to the crescendo of his first championship challenge at tender the age of 23 ‚Äì for it to go terribly and embarrassingly wrong. Rather than conducting the human heat of the 72,000 spectators in the style of Lewis Hamilton at Silverstone, however, Verstappen simply ignored it. There was a businesslike quality ‚Äì call it a robotic Red Bullness ‚Äì about Verstappen at Zandvoort as he came through the clouds of orange smoke to convert a routine pole position into a routine win, politely acknowledging the crowd without ever being carried away by them. They came, they saw, he conquered. Cutting the cord to his emotions has been a recurring theme of Verstappen‚Äôs 2021 season, allowing him to treat those two imposters, victory and defeat, just the same. Just as he refused to be fazed by the festival atmosphere at Zandvoort, so he declined to take Pirelli‚Äôs tyre failure in Baku ‚Äì costing him a certain 25 points ‚Äì as a personal insult, instead finding comfort from his pace and winning each of the following three races. That clarity of thought and inherent level-headedness has seen Verstappen develop a total immunity to pressure, which was again highlighted in the closing stages of a United States Grand Prix in which he further underlined his status as a World Champion in all but name. Winners at @COTA in the turbo hybrid era: 2014 ‚Äì Mercedes2015 ‚Äì Mercedes2016 ‚Äì Mercedes2017 ‚Äì Mercedes2018 ‚Äì Ferrari2019 ‚Äì Mercedes 2021 ‚Äì Red Bull What. A. Drive. #USGP #F1 pic.twitter.com/YwuD460EIf ‚Äî PlanetF1 (@Planet_F1) October 24, 2021 Perhaps Verstappen‚Äôs greatest achievement of 2021 has been to gradually eradicate the jeopardy in the air whenever he has found himself in the lead of a race. In previous years, with Verstappen slightly more impetuous and the Red Bull package slightly weaker, there was an overhanging sense that ‚Äì in an era of crushing Hamilton and Mercedes dominance ‚Äì it was too good to be true, that trouble was only ever just around the corner. Reality again appeared to be hitting Red Bull in the face at the Circuit of the Americas as Hamilton, on tyres eight laps younger ‚Äì a significant difference under the hot Texan sun ‚Äì caught Verstappen in the ferociously familiar fashion of Hungary 2019 and Spain earlier this year. Yet Verstappen remained calm and recognised what was required, perfectly judging the delicate balance between keeping Hamilton behind and keeping his hard tyres in good enough condition. When Hamilton hovered around a second behind in the final laps, Verstappen instinctively understood the importance of pushing hard through the first sector ‚Äì his Sector 1 time on the last lap was the fastest of anyone all race ‚Äì to deny him DRS assistance down the long back straight. If remaining poised under the expectation of Zandvoort was one thing, keeping the King of COTA behind in those circumstances and with so much on the line was quite another. His 18th career victory, and his eighth of 2021, was arguably his finest to date and yet another reminder that Verstappen is unlike anything Hamilton has faced before. He will not, regardless of his occasionally spiky answers to those in the FIA press conferences craving another collision between the pair, waste energy picking fights a la Fernando Alonso in 2007. He won‚Äôt allow himself to be worn down in the way Nico Rosberg was ‚Äì finally beating Lewis to the title in 2016 but, in career terms, dying trying ‚Äì and he is surely not set to self-destruct like Sebastian Vettel in 2017 and 2018. The potentially decisive significance of Austin is reflected in the Drivers‚Äô standings, with Verstappen now holding a 12-point lead over Hamilton with five races remaining ‚Äì the largest advantage for either driver since July ‚Äì when a Hamilton win would have seen him regain top spot by a single point. Given Red Bull‚Äôs historically strong record in the high altitude of Mexico, where Verstappen won with ease in 2017 and 2018, and Brazil, where he was on course to win comfortably until that collision with Esteban Ocon in ‚Äò18 before making up for it a year later, the opportunity to take control of the title race is obvious. And how will the thinner air of those venues affect a Mercedes team suddenly very nervous over the state of their power units, with Valtteri Bottas taking engine penalties in his last four races and relentless rumours of Hamilton requiring another before the season is over? In that context, when the American leg of the calendar is completed it is not outlandish to envisage Verstappen‚Äôs lead ‚Äì with bonus points for fastest laps and the Interlagos sprint race handed out ‚Äì being above the magic 25-point mark, affording him the luxury of retaining the championship lead even in the event of a DNF. ¬† Hamilton, of course, remains an ever-present threat, and if there is growing concern at Mercedes High Performance Powertrains it is remarkable that Honda ‚Äì given how it initially re-entered F1 in a cloud of smoke ‚Äì is yet to suffer a serious engine problem in its farewell season. But as in his 2016 defeat to Rosberg, there is an undeniable sense that Hamilton‚Äôs litany of lost points in Baku, Budapest and the sprints of Silverstone and Monza ‚Äì combined with Mercedes‚Äô stubborn refusal to compromise next year‚Äôs program by maintaining development of the 2021 car ‚Äì may have left him with too much to do in too little time. In this fascinating study of psychology that has been the 2021 F1 title battle, Hamilton of all people has been the one to crack most frequently. And it has left Verstappen with as clear a path as he could‚Äôve wished for towards his first World Championship. Pressure? What pressure? ¬† ¬† The post 2021 Max is unlike anything Hamilton has faced appeared first on PlanetF1.

Max had performed in front of large and expectant crowds before, of course, winning at Red Bull‚Äôs own circuit in Austria a total of four times (twice in 2021) and securing a victory of sorts in his second home race at Spa the previous weekend. But Zandvoort felt different. This, after all, was the race always meant to revolve around him and one that only existed because of him, the event the Dutch fans and their devotion to Verstappen had deserved since his F1 debut in 2015. The compact and high-downforce nature of Suzuka‚Äôs younger sibling favoured Red Bull, no doubt, but there was still a job to be done and plenty of potential ‚Äì with Verstappen embarking upon the climb to the crescendo of his first championship challenge at tender the age of 23 ‚Äì for it to go terribly and embarrassingly wrong. title: 'That‚Äôs a huge risk': Some Arsenal fans are sceptical over Arteta's reported game plan tonight
creator: Dylan Walsh
description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta is reportedly set to start a strong XI this evening against Leeds United in the League Cup. According to Football London,... The post 'That‚Äôs a huge risk': Some Arsenal fans are sceptical over Arteta's reported game plan tonight appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Stuart MacFarlane/Arsenal FC via Getty Images Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta is reportedly set to start a strong XI this evening against Leeds United in the League Cup. According to Football London, the Basque manager is keen to keep Arsenal‚Äôs momentum from Friday night going after a blistering 3-1 win over Aston Villa in the Premier League. With no Europe, the League Cup is the only source of tournament football for Arsenal this season. Meaning that fringe players and youngsters have not played too much this campaign. The likes of Gabriel Martinelli, Folarin Balogun and Eddie Nketiah have struggled for first-team minutes. And that‚Äôs in large part to a lack of European football. How Would A Squad Of Free Agents Do In The Championship? Football Manager 2021 ExperimentBridTV5827How Would A Squad Of Free Agents Do In The Championship? Football Manager 2021 Experiment883307883307centerUCsIwxKQajD9zPQA4SufVXggElecspo (Youtube)https://yt3.ggpht.com/a/AATXAJxUznA4lOkmaqkQUT9LEkoByQ5fpNm5IHUYaw=s800-c-k-c0xffffffff-no-rj-mo13872 Indeed, whilst it makes sense for Arsenal to go strong against Leeds, it will no doubt anger some players within the club. Bernd Leno, Rob Holding and Pablo Mari have not played a single minute of football since the 3-0 League Cup win against AFC Wimbledon. Yet tonight could see a very similar XI which saw Arsenal claim a huge three points over Villa last week. With Alexandre Lacazete, Albert Sambi Lokonga and Thomas Partey all featuring. Arsenal fans aren‚Äôt sold on Arteta‚Äôs plan for Leeds Photo by Robbie Jay Barratt ‚Äì AMA/Getty Images As you would expect, this update ahead of tonight‚Äôs clash against Leeds has not gone down well with Arsenal fans. title: 'Please stop': Some Spurs fans react to what Dele Alli's put on Instagram
creator: Amir Mir
description: Tottenham Hotspur fans have reacted on Twitter to Dele Alli‚Äôs Instagram story, where he is seemingly doing more fitness and strength work. Throughout the summer,... The post 'Please stop': Some Spurs fans react to what Dele Alli's put on Instagram appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Marc Atkins/Getty Images Tottenham Hotspur fans have reacted on Twitter to Dele Alli‚Äôs Instagram story, where he is seemingly doing more fitness and strength work. Throughout the summer, Spurs fans have seen Alli post various videos and images of him putting in the hard yards away from the pitch ‚Äì in the hope that things change for him out on the pitch. Dele via Instagram stories: "" pic.twitter.com/WkX2vKidpN‚Äî The Spurs Web (@thespursweb) October 25, 2021 Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce For‚Ä¶ ROONEY?!BridTV6077Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce For‚Ä¶ ROONEY?!886387886387center13872 But, it then frustrates them that they aren‚Äôt seeing the results out on the field of play. That‚Äôs the case once again, as he is now out of the first-team picture once again in North London. It does seem as though Spurs fans would rather see the end results on the field, rather than what Alli is doing outside of it. It doesn‚Äôt help Alli‚Äôs cause when his former boss ‚Äì Jose Mourinho ‚Äì calls him out for being ‚Äòlazy‚Äô in training, it‚Äôs probably a tag he won‚Äôt be able to shake-off unless he starts putting the ball into the back of the net again. Alli‚Äôs career, towards the back end of Mauricio Pochettino‚Äôs reign, during large parts of Mourinho‚Äôs tenure, and now under Nuno, has done nothing but go backwards. If the attack-minded midfielder could find an answer, he would no doubt bottle it up and use it every time he was in trouble. The issue facing Alli here is that it does seem as though he is on his last legs in North London. If he isn‚Äôt able to secure his first-team place under Nuno, then it wouldn‚Äôt be a surprise to see him leave and don the colours of another club ‚Äì probably as early as the winter transfer window. (@footyXupdate) October 25, 2021 pic.twitter.com/gjRFmiUhs9‚Äî James Tierney (@MrJamesTierney) October 25, 2021 He‚Äôs literally gonna be the same why is he doing this‚Äî kelly (@locelsoisdaddy) October 25, 2021 He is always at the gym and on the pitch we don‚Äôt see any results ‚Äî Imran dior ‚ôï (@imrandaboss) October 26, 2021 getting fit for newcastle in January siuuuu‚Äî Big Poppa (@godwinobiakor_) October 25, 2021 What‚Äôs the point?‚Äî Jay Read (@simplyjambo) October 25, 2021 Please stop https://t.co/PFoSgsJJtE‚Äî Mike (@THFCMikey) October 25, 2021 Never would‚Äôve thought his ability would be a bigger issue than his fitness https://t.co/csKS0K1GXM‚Äî Raffaad (@raffaad23) October 25, 2021 The post 'Please stop': Some Spurs fans react to what Dele Alli's put on Instagram appeared first on HITC.

title: Solskjaer expected to remain in charge of Man Utd
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to remain in charge as Manchester United manager despite their heavy defeat at the hands of Liverpool.
full_description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to remain in charge as Manchester United manager despite their heavy defeat at the hands of Liverpool. The feeling within the club is that while the result was bitterly disappointing and painful for everyone, the immediate focus is on improving after picking up one point from their last four Premier League games. United's next two Premier League matches are against Tottenham and Manchester City, both live on Sky Sports , and they also face Atalanta in the Champions League next week. But despite their poor results and huge external speculation, there is no suggestion from inside the club that Solskjaer's job is under threat at this point. Sky in Italy is reporting that former Chelsea manager Antonio Conte has been in contact with United about taking over should they decide to make a change. However, Sky Sports News understands that there has been no contact between the parties. Solskjaer called the 5-0 defeat to Liverpool - their heaviest home defeat in this fixture - his "darkest day" as United manager. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player The Norwegian was however adamant that the club are close to achieving success after he was asked if he was still the right man to lead the team. "We've come too far as a group and we're too close to give up now," he said on Sunday. "I've heard nothing else [about a potential departure]. This is the lowest I've been, but as I've said, I accept the responsibility. "I do believe in myself, I do believe that I am getting close to what I want with the club, I think what we've done, what I've seen, the development, of course, the results lately haven't been good enough. But I've got to keep strong and I do believe in what we've been doing, the coaching staff and the players." Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Solskjaer now faces the huge task of picking up his squad and staff ahead of their trip to Tottenham on Saturday Night Football . United are seventh in the Premier League after nine games, eight points behind leaders Chelsea, while Spurs are one point and one place above them in the table. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Gary Neville said he expected the club to stick with his former team-mate for at least the remainder of the season when debating Solskjaer's position with Jamie Carragher. "If this was in the immediate post-Sir Alex Ferguson era, Ole would be under massive pressure tonight," Neville said on Sunday. "But I think the club will hold their nerve. I don't think they have planned for a new manager this season. I think they will sit with him until the end of the season. There will be a massive outcry from fans and media that Ole should be sacked and I can understand that after that game. It was a monstrously bad day and it takes some recovery from. "The reason the board will stay stable is because of what happened with Jose Mourinho, with Louis van Gaal. They will not bring in a hitman again to try and do a job for a couple of seasons. Jose was the best manager in the world when he came here and it didn't work out. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player "Antonio Conte's available but I would not bring him in. I do not think he is a fit. I sacked a manager last season and it was the wrong thing to do. I should have waited until the end of the season, let it breathe, and I think that's what Manchester United will do." It does not get much easier; United face a formidable set of fixtures over the next six weeks as they look to keep pace in the Premier League and ensure Champions League qualification, with Chelsea, Arsenal, Tottenham and the Manchester derby looming domestically. October 30: Tottenham (a) - Premier League, kick-off 5.30pm, live on Sky Sports November 2: Atalanta (a) - Champions League, kick-off 8pm November 6: Man City (h) - Premier League, kick-off 12.30pm, live on Sky Sports November 20: Watford (a) - Premier League, kick-off 3pm November 23: Villarreal (a) - Champions League, kick-off 5.45pm November 28: Chelsea (a) - Premier League, kick-off 4.30pm, live on Sky Sports December 2: Arsenal (h) - Premier League, kick-off 8.15pm Another Saturday, another chance to win ¬£250,000 with Super 6. Play for free, entries by 3pm.

creator: Alexander Kaindl
description: Der FC Bayern M√ºnchen bastelt schon jetzt am Kader der Zukunft. Offenbar spielt dabei auch ein s√ºndteurer Kolumbianer eine Rolle - sagt zumindest ein Insider.
full_description: Der FC Bayern M√ºnchen bastelt schon jetzt am Kader der Zukunft. Offenbar spielt dabei auch ein s√ºndteurer Kolumbianer eine Rolle - sagt zumindest ein Insider. M√ºnchen - Der FC Bayern steht in den kommenden Jahren wohl wieder vor einem kleinen Umbruch. Topstars wie Manuel Neuer (35), Robert Lewandowski (33) oder Thomas M√ºller (32) werden nicht mehr ewig spielen k√∂nnen, es braucht deshalb bald neue Sterne am M√ºnchner Fu√üball-Himmel. Manch einen hat man ohnehin schon im Kader. Es gilt als ausgemachte Sache, dass Jamal Musiala eines Tages in die M√ºller-Fu√üstapfen treten soll, in der Defensive hat man mit Tanguy Nianzou au√üerdem schon l√§ngst einen Spieler verpflichtet, dem Insider eines Tages die Weltklasse zutrauen. Es w√§chst also wieder etwas heran an der S√§bener Stra√üe. Und trotzdem ist man nat√ºrlich auch auf der Suche nach externen Verst√§rkungen. Vor allem in der Offensive wollen die Bayern dem Vernehmen nach aktiv werden. Warum? Weil sich bei Kingsley Coman die Anzeichen verdichten, dass er den Verein m√∂glicherweise schon bald verlassen k√∂nnte. Der Tempodribbler hat seinen Vertrag, der im Sommer 2023 ausl√§uft, bislang nicht verl√§ngert. Offenbar sind die Vorstellungen in Sachen Gehalt bei den verhandelnden Parteien zu unterschiedlich. Ein Wechsel im kommenden Sommer gilt nach aktuellem Stand deshalb als wahrscheinlich. Klar ist: Sollte Coman gehen, braucht es hochkar√§tigen Ersatz. Leroy San√© und Serge Gnabry sind an guten Tagen zwar Weltklasse, aber: Nat√ºrlich k√∂nnen sie nicht alle Spiele in einer Saison bestreiten. Dar√ºber hinaus schlagen sich beide immer wieder mit Verletzungen herum - aufgrund ihres Tempo-Spiels ist das nicht einmal verwunderlich. Wer k√∂nnte also Coman ersetzen, falls sich der Franzose aus M√ºnchen verabschieden sollte? Ein Transfer-Insider bringt nun einen Namen ins Spiel, der in der Vergangenheit schon das eine oder andere Mal gehandelt wurde: Luis Diaz. Nicolo Schira behauptet auf seinem Twitter-Kanal, dass aktuell viele europ√§ische Klubs ein Auge auf den Kolumbianer vom FC Porto geworfen haben. Der 24-J√§hrige pr√§sentiert sich vor allem in der laufenden Saison in bestechender Form: In zw√∂lf Partien (portugiesische Liga und Champions League) kommt der linke Fl√ºgelspieler auf sieben Tore und eine Vorlage. Ein Wert, der so manchen Interessenten auf den Plan ruft. Laut Transfer-Guru Schira seien Newcastle, Chelsea, Real Madrid und eben der FC Bayern an Diaz interessiert. Alle vier Klubs h√§tten sich angeblich beim FC Porto schon nach dem torgef√§hrlichen Offensivmann erkundigt. Wer Diaz haben will, m√ºsste aber tief in die Tasche greifen: Laut Schira gibt es eine Ausstiegsklausel in H√∂he von 80 Millionen Euro. F√ºr das neureiche Newcastle w√§re das wohl kein Problem, schlie√ülich hat man nun einen milliardenschweren Scheich im Hintergrund, der den Magpies mit seinen Geldern richtig teure Beine kaufen k√∂nnte. Aber ob die Bayern auf diesen Zug aufspringen? Wohl kaum. Coman hat derzeit einen Marktwert von 55 Millionen Euro, eine Abl√∂sesumme in dieser Preiskategorie erscheint f√ºr den kommenden Sommer bei einem m√∂glichen Wechsel als wahrscheinlich. Die Bayern wirtschaften seit jeher √§u√üerst gesund, die Corona-Lage hat die Bosse um Sportvorstand Hasan Salihamidzic nochmal aufmerksamer gemacht. Deshalb ist es kaum vorstellbar, dass sie f√ºr Diaz derart tief in die Tasche greifen w√ºrden. Egal, wohin es den Kolumbianer schlie√ülich ziehen wird: Bei Porto ist man prominente und teure Abg√§nge ja schon gewohnt. Jedes Jahr gibt man Spieler f√ºr etliche Millionen ab. Trainer Sergio Conceicao sagte √ºber Diaz zuletzt: ‚ÄûGer√ºchte und Nachrichten √ºber Dinge, die passieren oder eben nicht passieren k√∂nnen, bereiten mir keine Kopfschmerzen.‚Äù Ihm d√ºrfte aber auch klar sein: Einer seiner besten Spieler wird schon bald woanders aktiv sein. Die Frage ist dann nur: Wann und f√ºr wen? Selbst wenn Transfer-Experte Schira Recht haben und der FC Bayern Diaz beobachten sollte: F√ºr 80 Millionen Euro werden sie ihn nach aktueller Lage kaum verpflichten. (akl)
