content: Der FC Bayern hat sich in den vergangenen Spielen in absoluter Topform pr√§sentiert und seine Gegner teilweise in Grund und Boden gespielt. Nicht nur die FCB-Fans sind von der Nagelsmann-Truppe begeistert, auch Uli Hoene√ü schw√§rmt von der Art und Weise wie sich Robert Lewandowski & Co. zuletzt pr√§sentiert haben. Mit 13:1-Toren in den letzten drei Spielen hat der FC Bayern seine Gegner zuletzt regelrecht √ºberrollt. Bemerkenswert ist dabei: Mit Bayer Leverkusen, Benfica Lissabon und der TSG Hoffenheim hatten die M√ºnchner keine wirkliche Laufkundschaft. Zudem musste man zuletzt zwei Mal in Folge auf Cheftrainer Julian Nagelsmann verzichten. Auch Uli Hoene√ü kam zuletzt aus dem Staunen nicht raus, wie der Ehrenpr√§sident der Bayern verraten hat: ‚ÄúDas Spiel in Leverkusen oder die zweite Halbzeit in Lissabon oder auch die ersten 20 Minuten am Samstag, da habe ich gedacht, ich bin in Hollywood. Das ist erstaunlich, wie traumwandlerisch die Mannschaft Fu√üball spielt.‚Äù ‚ÄúDas liebt der Zuschauer‚Äù Der 69-j√§hrige zog zudem einen etwas kuriosen Vergleich, mit dem die meisten Bayern-Fans nur wenig anfangen k√∂nnen: ‚ÄúAm meisten gef√§llt mir, dass sie bis zur letzten Minute hei√ü ist, Tore zu machen. Das liebt der Zuschauer. Der zahlt bei einem Elton-John-Konzert auch nicht nur f√ºr die ersten zehn Songs, sondern bis zum Schluss. title: 'Is that a typo': Some Newcastle fans can't believe 'masterclass' move from ¬£12m ace for U-23s
creator: Dylan Walsh
description: Newcastle midfielder Jonjo Shelvey started for the U-23s last night in a Premier League 2 fixture against Wolves. And the midfielder impressed. The ¬£12m signing... The post 'Is that a typo': Some Newcastle fans can't believe 'masterclass' move from ¬£12m ace for U-23s appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Visionhaus/Getty Images Newcastle midfielder Jonjo Shelvey started for the U-23s last night in a Premier League 2 fixture against Wolves. And the midfielder impressed. The ¬£12m signing from Swansea City has been out with injury for most of the season. Shelvey played briefly against Tottenham Hotspur before the midfielder was shown a straight red card after coming on as a substitute. And under caretaker manager Graeme Jones, Shelvey has been sent with the U-23s to regain his fitness for the duration of his suspension. And the 29-year-old put in a good shift. The Newcastle ace bagged two assists as the Magpies lost 3-2 to Wolves. Yet on social media, supporters were happy with Shelvey‚Äôs performance on the night. Yet overall, fans were happy with how Shelvey‚Äôs display for the U-23s. Under Jones, the midfielder could regain his first-team spot once his suspension is completed. Newcastle fans stunned by Shelvey display for U-23s Robbie Jay Barratt ‚Äì AMA/Getty Images Indeed, Shelvey used the chance with the U-23s to full effect last night. And on social media, supporters were pleased with how the 29-year-old performed with the young squad. title: 'As if Levy would pay': Some Spurs fans react as club reportedly eye ¬£96m World Cup winner
creator: Dylan Walsh
description: Tottenham are reportedly keen on signing Ousmane Dembele, who is set to leave FC Barcelona just four years after joining the club for ¬£96m. 90min... The post 'As if Levy would pay': Some Spurs fans react as club reportedly eye ¬£96m World Cup winner appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by FRANCK FIFE/AFP via Getty Images Tottenham are reportedly keen on signing Ousmane Dembele, who is set to leave FC Barcelona just four years after joining the club for ¬£96m. 90min claim that the Premier League is the most likely destination for the 24-year-old attacker. And that the likes of Manchester City, Newcastle United and Tottenham are all eager on Dembele. The winger‚Äôs contract with the La Liga giants is set to expire next summer. Yet despite a huge-money move to Spain a few years ago, Barcelona are eager to cut ties with Dembele. The 2018 FIFA World Cup winner has struggled massively with injuries during his spell in Catalonia. Indeed, a change of scenery could do Dembele and his career a world of good given his obvious talents. Republic Of Ireland Squad If All Eligible Players Declared For Them | Football Manager 2021BridTV5411Republic Of Ireland Squad If All Eligible Players Declared For Them | Football Manager 2021874090874090centerUCsIwxKQajD9zPQA4SufVXggElecspo (Youtube)https://yt3.ggpht.com/a/AATXAJxUznA4lOkmaqkQUT9LEkoByQ5fpNm5IHUYaw=s800-c-k-c0xffffffff-no-rj-mo13872 Moreover, now Tottenham are in the race for the forward. The north London side have struggled with both goals and creativity this season, and Dembele can offer both to Nuno Espirito Santo‚Äôs side if he can stay fully fit. Yet for fans on social media, some are not certain on Dembele joining Tottenham in the coming months. Mainly due to the finances that could be involved. Tottenham fans laugh off Dembele rumour Photo by Cristian Trujillo/Quality Sport Images/Getty Images After all, Daniel Levy is notorious for being quite tight when it comes to finances. And given Dembele‚Äôs hefty wage, the Tottenham chairman will have to break some club records to acquire the attacker. title: 'One of the funniest': Some Liverpool fans & Dalglish's son react to Alex Ferguson footage
creator: Amir Mir
description: Liverpool fans have reacted on Twitter to footage of Alex Ferguson‚Äôs reaction to Manchester United being 5-0 down at Old Trafford on Sunday. Moments after... The post 'One of the funniest': Some Liverpool fans & Dalglish's son react to Alex Ferguson footage appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by OLI SCARFF/AFP via Getty Images Liverpool fans have reacted on Twitter to footage of Alex Ferguson‚Äôs reaction to Manchester United being 5-0 down at Old Trafford on Sunday. Moments after Mo Salah scored Liverpool‚Äôs fifth, the cameras panned to Sir Alex in the stands, with the Premier League legend expressing a sigh of frustration and a face of ‚Äòwhat have I just seen?‚Äô. What made matters even better for Liverpool fans is that pictures then showed Kenny Dalglish laughing away on another side of the ground. This is how his son, Paul Dalglish, reacted to the footage: 5-0 faces! pic.twitter.com/CWfZIVSlxH‚Äî Paul Dalglish (@DalglishPaul) October 24, 2021 Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce For‚Ä¶ ROONEY?!BridTV6077Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce For‚Ä¶ ROONEY?!886387886387center13872 It was perhaps an image summing up of what Manchester United fans would have felt, at that moment. And what the Liverpool faithful would have been thinking, because it was an utterly dominant display from them. Liverpool fans would have, no doubt, backed themselves to secure all three points before the weekend‚Äôs game. But not many, if anyone, would have predicted Jurgen Klopp‚Äôs side to put in such a dominant and now historical performance. This display and thrashing will be remembered for not just years, but decades to come. And what makes matters worse, for those in Manchester, is if Liverpool now go on to win the Premier League title this season. Nonetheless, here is a selection of Liverpool fans reacting to the Sir Alex footage: Imagine spending the best part of 3 decades & the majority of your career trying to knock the most successful team in england off their perch only to retire & watch everything you've achieved crumble around you while that said team takes it back & doing it in his backyard too.‚Äî Simesy (@Simon42915599) October 24, 2021 What makes it sweeter is that Fergie is still involved in team affairs ‚Äì he was the most influential in re-signing Ronaldo, not Solskjaer, not that it's doing #ManUtd any good.‚Äî Derek Brosnan (@DerekBrosnan) October 25, 2021 pic.twitter.com/qTpQdxYRHY‚Äî Eii (@radityarvan) October 25, 2021 Seriously concerned Fergie's nose was going to actually explode at that point. pic.twitter.com/ZAQPAycoBB‚Äî Lawrence Monk (@trendylefty) October 24, 2021 Only one King‚Äî Stephen Finn (@ScarFinn79) October 24, 2021 Ferguson saying " this Liverpool team is light years ahead of us, they're a million miles in front of our treble winners too"‚Äî fracturedleg (@Fracturedlegs) October 25, 2021 No better smile than a king Kenny smile‚Ä¶.#upthereds‚Äî paul marshall (@PaulMarsh4053) October 24, 2021 This was one of the funniest things I have seen in‚Äî post muzik (@postmuzik) October 24, 2021 The best bit of production I‚Äôve ever seen on sky this‚Äî Baltic Fleet (@BalticFleetUK) October 24, 2021 The post 'One of the funniest': Some Liverpool fans & Dalglish's son react to Alex Ferguson footage appeared first on HITC.

title: Coach says more games the answer after Jets suffer reality check
creator: JAMES GARDINER
description: "There were a lot of positives. We created some really good chances. We also got punished for some pretty poor errors."
full_description: ON TARGET: Elvis Kamsoba opened the scoring for Sydney FC as the Sky Blues inflicted a 5-0 defeat of the Newcastle Jets at Macquarie University on Tuesday. Picture: Jaime Castaneda. NEWCASTLE Jets coach Arthur Papas believes his new-look outfit simply need games together after they were punished for their mistakes by a clinical Sydney FC. In their first hit out against A-League opposition - a modified trial played over three 45-minute periods - the Jets went down 5-0 in Sydney on Tuesday. "The result was disappointing," Papas said. "But the result doesn't always befit the performance. "I was pleased with a lot of aspects. There were a lot of positives. We created some really good chances. "We also got punished for some pretty poor errors. "At the other end, we hit the post a few times and weren't scoring goals. "It was a perfect test for us. The perfect opponent, the benchmark team in the league. "I said to the players at half time - that is a team that has been together four years. This is a team who is playing their first game together against a professional opponent. "We get to build on that and play more games." The Jets travel to Sydney to take on NSW NPL side APIA Leichhardt on Saturday and Macarthur (November 6) before their FFA Cup round-of-32 qualifier against Western United in Melbourne on November 13. FOCUSED: Jets coach Arthur Papas. Picture: Simone De Peak They kick off their A-League campaign against arch rivals the Central Coast at McDonald Jones Stadium on November 21. The Mariners beat Macarthur 3-1 in a friendly on Tuesday. "My main thing is to make sure on a daily basis we are improving," Papas said. "We know what points we need to focus on now." In an up-tempo and at times fiery contest, Elvis Kamsoba and Max Burgess swooped on mistakes to give Sydney a 2-0 lead at the first break. Marquee men Adam Le Fondre and Kosta Barbarouses struck in the second period to double the Sky Blues' advantage before Trent Buhagiar completed the scoring. For the Jets, Beka Mikeltadze, Savvas Siatravanis, Valentino Yuel and Jordan O'Doherty were denied by the woodwork. "I thought some of our movement was positive," Papas said. "Our ability to get in behind them and create chances was positive. Overall, we need to be a bit sharper. The precision of our first touch and our passing needs to be better. You get punished for it very quickly." After a 2020-21 campaign in which the Jets just avoided the wooden spoon, new coach Arthur Papas overhauled the roster and welcomed 15 fresh faces. READ MORE: JETS PRIMED FOR PRE-SEASON TEST READ MORE: SOUTH SUDAN EXPERIEMVE HAS YUEL HUNGRY FOR MORE READ MORE: TEENAGER NOT AFRAID TO 'STEP ON TOES' READ MORE: JETS GUNNING FOR FAST START They have been training since July, but due to COVID restrictions had been unable to test themselves against opposition teams. After an easing of the public health order last week, the Jets had two short hit outs against Northern NSW club Broadmeadow Magic, which they won comfortably. However, it was a big step up to heavyweights Sydney, who were coming off a 5-0 win over Macarthur. "Sydney had three new players - Elvis Kamsoba, Max Burgess and James Donachie. The rest have been together for for years," Papas said. "It was a great experience for a lot of our guys who were playing together against a professional team for the the first time. There wasn't anything that surprised us. "We know we have to keep getting better, keep working. "We got 90 minutes into a lot of them, we got 75 minutes into a lot of them ... that is the first time we had to do that against an A-League team." Papas said keeper jack Duncan did well considering the scoreline and also highlighted the efforts of Kosta Grozos, Siatravanis, Boumal and Mo Al-Taay. Meanwhile, Macarthur have moved swiftly to fill the void left by captain Adam Federici's unexpected retirement, signing Filip Kurto. Kurto joins the Bulls after previous stints at Western United and Wellington Phoenix. The signing of the 190cm Polish goalkeeper comes just days after ex-Socceroos shot-stopper Federici announced he was hanging up his gloves with immediate effect due to injury. That decision left Macarthur with only 21-year-old Nick Suman on their books as senior goalkeepers. Kurto, 30, was named goalkeeper of the year after an impressive campaign with the Phoenix in 2018-19 but was released by Western United in June after an injury-marred season which included repeated bouts of concussion. Bulls coach Ante Milicic said Kurto's experience will be a plus for his side heading into the new campaign. "Filip will bring his invaluable European and A-League knowledge and experience to our squad," Milicic said. "Alongside Nick Suman he will give us tremendous security in the goalkeeping department. "He has been outstanding in his A-League journey so far and I look forward to watching what he can bring under the guidance of myself and (goalkeeping coach) Glen Moss for the upcoming season." Macarthur open their second ALM season against the Phoenix at Campbelltown Stadium on November 21. IN THE NEWS: Our journalists work hard to provide local, up-to-date news to the community. title: Filosofische Hamilton waarschuwt Verstappen: "Het is nog niet voorbij!"
creator: Jesse Janse
description: Lewis Hamilton is en blijft strijdlustig, tot aan de laatste snik. De Brit, die afgelopen weekend werd verslagen door Max Verstappen en zijn achterstand in het kampioenschap zag groeien, geeft zich logischerwijs nog lang niet gewonnen!
content: Tijdens een op papier sterke periode voor Mercedes wist Lewis Hamilton geen gat te slaan in de strijd om de wereldtitel. Sterker nog, door een straf in Turkije verloor hij de leiding in het kampioenschap aan Max Verstappen. De Nederlander wist afgelopen weekend in de Verenigde Staten zijn voorsprong verder uit te breiden. Nu er twee ciruits aankomen die op papier Red Bull beter liggen, kan Verstappen met een comfortabele voorsprong de laatste drie races van het jaar ingaan. Hamilton weet echter dat niets vanzelfsprekend is tijdens het Formule 1-seizoen 2021 en is en blijft zeer strijdlustig. De strijd is nog langer niet voorbij. Daags na de race laat Hamilton zich uit op Instagram, waar hij uitpakt met de tekst: "It's not over! Maandag was een dag van reflectie. We hebben op zondag alles gegeven, maar achteraf heb je altijd door dat je meer had kunnen of misschien wel moeten doen. We beoordelen, hergroeperen, laden ons weer op en gaan het gevecht weer aan!" "Er is nog steeds tijd. Er zijn obstakels, maar samen kunnen we alles bereiken als we ons daar op richten. Laten we blijven pushen, iedereen! We blijven fit, we blijven sterk, we blijven gefocust en still we rise !", aldus de Mercedes-coureur filosofisch. De volgende Grand Prix is over een kleine twee weken, in Mexico. Daar zal Hamilton proberen zijn achterstand van twaalf punten op Verstappen te verkleinen of te laten verdwijnen.

title: RV against clock to fix scanner for Cup runners
description: Melbourne Cup internationals, including Twilight Payment and Spanish Mission, had X-rays of their limbs taken on Tuesday, as Racing Victoria aims to have its standing CT scanner fixed late Wednesday.
full_description: Melbourne Cup internationals, including Twilight Payment and Spanish Mission, had X-rays of their limbs taken on Tuesday, as Racing Victoria aims to have its standing CT scanner fixed late Wednesday. The busted digital board ‚Äî albeit untimely a week out from the Cup ‚Äî is understood to be a world-first malfunction of the part responsible for generating the scanner images. A cargo flight carrying the American component is due to touch down on Wednesday, with technicians on standby to repair the $1.27m standing CT scanner at U-Vet Equine Centre, Werribee. The standing scanner was introduced in 2019 to help RV and the University of Melbourne understand and further help reduce limb injuries in horses. News Corp Australia understands the scanner was fully maintained and serviced ahead of the spring carnival period but the malfunction, ‚Äúa truly unique occurrence‚Äù could not be foreseen. An RV spokesman confirmed the scanner malfunction would form part of the annual review into the entire spring carnival, including the stringent veterinary processes. The unfortunate situation generally has triggered talks within industry groups about the need for a failsafe ‚Äî should current screening rules stay in place ‚Äî in the event of another malfunction, given what is at stake and the impact on connections. As announced on Monday, the 15 Melbourne Cup fourth acceptors who had not undergone a standing CT prior to the machine breaking down will be subjected to high quality X-rays. The X-rays must be reviewed and cleared by three international imaging specialists for Cup horses to press on towards Flemington next Tuesday. RV mandated a stringent veterinary screening regimen after Anthony Van Dyck last year became the sixth Cup runner in seven years to sustain a catastrophic injury. The fact the four internationals this year passed a series of scans ‚Äì including the contentious scintigraphy ‚Äì prior to arriving in Australia gives RV some clarity and peace of mind. The standing CT scanner was used voluntarily by connections previously to check or help diagnose potential issues, but this year all Cup horses must be scanned before Thursday‚Äôs deadline. Should any of the high quality X-rays taken the past 48 hours highlight an area of concern the horses may be required to undergo a standing CT scan on Thursday, subject to availability. This would also apply to any Cup-nominated horses who contest Wednesday‚Äôs Bendigo Cup and have not yet had a scan. Horses face additional scrutiny beyond the scans, including a new Cup eve veterinary inspection. What is the standing CT scanner? A large, fixed structure located at the University of Melbourne‚Äôs U-Vet Equine Centre in Werribee. When introduced in 2019 it was the first of its kind in Australia. A second was introduced at the Randwick Equine Centre in Sydney this year. Why was the CT scanner brought in? What improvements does it provide on? The standing CT scanner was introduced to understand and further help reduce limb injuries in horses. Apart from early identification of issues, before they become serious or fatal, a major benefit of the standing CT scanner is it can be used on horses with limited sedation. Traditional CT machines require a horse to undergo a general anaesthetic, meaning it‚Äôs not suitable for the precautionary screening of all Cup horses. Traditional/previous testing methods Up until 2020 horses only underwent scanning before the Cup if they were injured or vets needed further information to diagnose a possible injury. In 2021 that has changed to precautionary scanning of all Cup horses, regardless of their condition. All Cup horses are traditionally subjected to a pre-race veterinary examination ‚Äì a visual/manipulative assessment where they are trotted up before a panel of vets ‚Äì on the Thursday or Friday before the race. This year, an additional one has been scheduled for Cup eve. Which horses have/haven‚Äôt been scanned? 19 of the 35 fourth acceptors for the Melbourne Cup have been presented for a standing CT scan since October 16, in line with the RV veterinary requirements for the race. The four internationals ‚Äì Spanish Mission, Twilight Payment, Away He Goes and Sir Lucan ‚Äì have not been scanned in Australia but did clear all diagnostics since their last race start and prior to departure. Has the machine already ruled out other horses this year? Yes, Cup nominees Young Werther and Harpo Marx have been withdrawn after their scans highlighted areas of concerns. All CT scans and X-rays are reviewed by a panel of three veterinary specialists (one each in USA, UK and Australia) and the results presented to the RV veterinary team to make a decision on each horse‚Äôs suitability to race. Are horses at a heightened risk of injury without this scan? No, the risk of injury is the same as with any physical/athletic activity. How much does the machine cost? RV together with the University of Melbourne and the State Government invested $1.27 million What is being done if a horse can‚Äôt undergo a standing CT scan? All acceptors yet to undergo a standing CT scan are required to undergo a comprehensive high-quality X-rays of their distal limbs on October 26-27. Should the X-rays taken at U-Vet identify any area of concern, the horse may be required to undertake an MRI or standing CT scan (subject to availability) on or before October 28. If the replacement part arrives in time, can a horse get scanned by Thursday night? All Cup horses will undergo a standing CT scan or high-quality X-rays by Thursday night. Thursday is the cut-off for horses who will be mildly sedated for their standing CT scan or X-rays (if required) in order to produce a clear drug test for the sedative on Cup Day. Originally published as Racing Victoria against the clock to fix CT scanner for Melbourne Cup runners To join the conversation, please log in. Don't have an account? Register Join the conversation, you are commenting as Logout Fred Kersley is using the frustration of finishing second in last year‚Äôs Victoria Derby as motivation to go one better this time. Epsom Handicap winner Private Eye has drawn near the outside for Saturday‚Äôs Golden Eagle but trainer Joe Pride just wants a solid tempo in the $7.5 million feature. When cancer survivor Felicity Krzanic received a slot in the Four Pillars, she settled on a horse renowned for his fighting spirit, just like her close friend Nini Vascotto.

content: Sein Berater gibt pikante Vertrags-Details bekannt: Julian Nagelsmann verzichtete bei den Verhandlungen freiwillig auf 15 Prozent seines Gehalts beim FC Bayern. Bild: imago images / nordphotoDeutschlands vielleicht m√§chtigster Spieler-Berater Volker Struth packt aus. In seinem neuen Buch "Meine Spielz√ºge. Aus der Kohlensiedlung zum erfolgreichsten Spielerberater Deutschlands", das am Donnerstag erscheint, schreibt er auch √ºber pikante Vertragsdetails zwischen dem FC Bayern und Trainer Julian Nagelsmann. Diese Details ver√∂ffentlichte die "Sport Bild" jetzt als Auszug aus Struths Buch.Seinen Ausf√ºhrungen zufolge soll Julian Nagelsmann sogar auf 15 Prozent seines urspr√ºnglichen Gehalts beim FC Bayern verzichten. Nachdem der ehemalige Bundestrainer Joachim L√∂w im Fr√ºhjahr seinen R√ºcktritt zum Saisonende bei der Nationalmannschaft bekannt gegeben hatte, wollte Hansi Flick, wiederum bisheriger Bayerntrainer, im Sommer die DFB-Elf √ºbernehmen....(Auf https://www.watson.de lesen)

title: ‚ÄúThis Chicago Bulls team is as good as the Michael Jordan 1996 team‚Äù: NBA Twitter reacts as Lonzo Ball, Zach LaVine and co. start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time in 25 years
creator: Advait Jajodia
description: Grabbing a close 111-108 win against the Raptors, the Chicago Bulls now start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time since the 1996-1997 season. Over the past couple of years, the Chicago Bulls have been a lottery team at best, failing to make the postseason consistently. However, this offseason, the Bulls‚Ä¶ The post ‚ÄúThis Chicago Bulls team is as good as the Michael Jordan 1996 team‚Äù: NBA Twitter reacts as Lonzo Ball, Zach LaVine and co. start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time in 25 years appeared first on The SportsRush.
content: Grabbing a close 111-108 win against the Raptors, the Chicago Bulls now start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time since the 1996-1997 season. Over the past couple of years, the Chicago Bulls have been a lottery team at best, failing to make the postseason consistently. However, this offseason, the Bulls front office managed to surround Zach LaVine with some talented players like DeMar DeRozan, Lonzo Ball, among many others. And all of a sudden, this squad looks to be a pretty deadly bunch of players. As expected, the Bulls have been playing much better than they have over the past few years. After defeating the Pistons, Pelicans and again the Pistons in their first three games, LaVine and co. looked confident entering the Scotiabank Arena. Even though the Raptors managed to cut down the lead tremendously, it was Chicago winning their 4th consecutive game. It was an efficient night for DeMar, finishing with 26 points, 6 assists and 4 rebounds on 36.8/50/100 shooting splits, with Zach contributing 22 points on 43.8% shooting from the field, helping Chicago win 111-108. And with this win, the Bulls now have started the regular season with a winning 4-0 record. The Chicago Bulls mean business pic.twitter.com/2vlyUAkzF0 ‚Äî SportsCenter (@SportsCenter) October 26, 2021 Also Read: NBA Twitter reacts to the Celtics star‚Äôs insane overtime poster over Hornets‚Äô Miles Bridges NBA Twitter reacts to Chicago Bulls and their first 4-0 regular-season start since 1996-97 campaign The Bulls are one of only three teams who are undefeated, and the only team to win all four of their games. The last time they did so? Back when Michael Jordan was leading the team during the 1996-1997 season. NBA Twitter went crazy with reactions after the Bulls‚Äô 4-0 record. The Chicago Bulls good at basketball again pic.twitter.com/GUgCJj1zGv ‚Äî Dev (@goatkurosaki) October 26, 2021 I can‚Äôt see the Chicago Bulls losing any time soon. This is literally the 96-97 bulls in 2021 ‚Äî Troydan (@Troydan) October 26, 2021 The Orlando Magic started 4-0 last season and ended up eliminated in the Playoffs.. lol ‚Äî James3 (@Son0faBeach305) October 26, 2021 BEST TEAM IN THE LEAGUE CONFIRMED pic.twitter.com/WIXHJNK5AE ‚Äî Delusional Lonzo Fan(4-0) (@DelusionalZoFan) October 26, 2021 Also Read: Nets head coach Steve Nash warns the return of a prime James Harden After winning the game on the road, the Bulls will go back to Chicago and play the Knicks and the Jazz. While this team might not be the title favourite, it surely can cause a problem for many powerhouses. The post ‚ÄúThis Chicago Bulls team is as good as the Michael Jordan 1996 team‚Äù: NBA Twitter reacts as Lonzo Ball, Zach LaVine and co. start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time in 25 years appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Paper Talk: Salah agent sets new demand as Euro giant prepares move; Man City in double battle for exciting signings
creator: Samuel Bannister
description: There has been a fresh update regarding the state of play between Mohamed Salah and Liverpool in their contract negotiations The post Paper Talk: Salah agent sets new demand as Euro giant prepares move; Man City in double battle for exciting signings appeared first on TEAMtalk.
content: There has been a fresh update regarding the state of play between Mohamed Salah and Liverpool in contract negotiations, while Manchester City are battling the same rival for two players ‚Äì all in Tuesday‚Äôs transfer gossip. AGENT RAISES SALAH WAGE DEMANDS Mohamed Salah is seeking a weekly wage of ¬£500,000 from any new contract he signs at Liverpool. Salah recently indicated a desire to spend the rest of his career at Liverpool. However, as things stand, his contract will expire in 2023. Liverpool have thus outlined his situation as a priority issue to resolve. But given his status as arguably the most in-form player in the world, an extension will not come cheap. Approaching his 30s, Liverpool must weigh up whether it would be worth investing in Salah for a longer term. But on current form it would seem unreasonable to consider letting him go. That may play into his hands ‚Äì or his agent‚Äôs ‚Äì and details have now emerged of what he would be demanding from a new contract. According to Football Insider, Salah wants half a million pounds every week as part of a new Liverpool contract. It would make him the club‚Äôs best-paid player of all time. Such a figure is slightly higher than what had previously been reported and will give Reds chiefs some serious thinking to do. Representative Ramy Abbas is driving the demands for his client. As long as Salah continues his fine form, their position will be strengthened. Now, it will be up to Liverpool‚Äôs Boston-based owners to make the final decisions. At present, they are ‚Äúreluctant‚Äù to give him a new deal on money-no-object terms given that they would last until his mid-30s. Therefore, an agreement is ‚Äúsome way away‚Äù despite Salah‚Äôs recent promising comments. That may be a concern given that Ekrem Konur is reporting that Real Madrid are monitoring the situation and will move for Salah if Liverpool fail to tie him down. Conte, Zidane, Ten Hag: Who will replace Solskjaer if he gets the sack at Man Utd? MAN CITY IN DOUBLE TRANSFER BATTLE Manchester City could battle Bayern Munich for the signature of Barcelona midfielder Frenkie De Jong. full_description: There has been a fresh update regarding the state of play between Mohamed Salah and Liverpool in contract negotiations, while Manchester City are battling the same rival for two players ‚Äì all in Tuesday‚Äôs transfer gossip. Mohamed Salah is seeking a weekly wage of ¬£500,000 from any new contract he signs at Liverpool. Salah recently indicated a desire to spend the rest of his career at Liverpool . However, as things stand, his contract will expire in 2023. Liverpool have thus outlined his situation as a priority issue to resolve. But given his status as arguably the most in-form player in the world, an extension will not come cheap. Approaching his 30s, Liverpool must weigh up whether it would be worth investing in Salah for a longer term. But on current form it would seem unreasonable to consider letting him go. That may play into his hands ‚Äì or his agent‚Äôs ‚Äì and details have now emerged of what he would be demanding from a new contract. According to Football Insider , Salah wants half a million pounds every week as part of a new Liverpool contract. It would make him the club‚Äôs best-paid player of all time. Such a figure is slightly higher than what had previously been reported and will give Reds chiefs some serious thinking to do. Representative Ramy Abbas is driving the demands for his client. As long as Salah continues his fine form, their position will be strengthened. Now, it will be up to Liverpool‚Äôs Boston-based owners to make the final decisions. At present, they are ‚Äúreluctant‚Äù to give him a new deal on money-no-object terms given that they would last until his mid-30s. Therefore, an agreement is ‚Äúsome way away‚Äù despite Salah‚Äôs recent promising comments. That may be a concern given that Ekrem Konur is reporting that Real Madrid are monitoring the situation and will move for Salah if Liverpool fail to tie him down. title: Smith‚Äôs empathy for the fickle finger of Stokes

title: Smith‚Äôs empathy for the fickle finger of Stokes
creator: Daniel Brettig
description: Steve Smith knows what star England all-rounder Ben Stokes meant when he gripped the bat after finger surgery and immediately thought ‚ÄúI‚Äôm back‚Äù.
full_description: Steve Smith knows what Ben Stokes meant when he gripped the bat handle after his second round of finger surgery this year and immediately thought ‚ÄúI‚Äôm back‚Äù - a moment that has reshaped the whole picture of this summer‚Äôs Ashes series. Back in February 2019, towards the latter stages of his Newlands ban, Smith removed an elbow brace after surgery and, a matter of days after he had questioned his future in the game, posted a video of himself batting in the nets. Smith‚Äôs 2019 Ashes heroics flowed from there. Steve Smith is rationing his net sessions following more elbow trouble earlier this year. Credit: Getty Images While Smith has admitted he is still rationing his own famously prolific net sessions after another bout of elbow trouble earlier this year, his empathy for Stokes - and also New Zealand captain Kane Williamson, also currently battling an elbow problem during the T20 World Cup - is clear. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never comfortable when you‚Äôre going through some pain out in the middle,‚Äù Smith said from Dubai. ‚ÄúI think Kane Williamson is probably one going through it at the moment, I think he‚Äôs got some tennis elbow stuff that I had earlier this year going on, and it‚Äôs not a very comfortable place to be in. ‚ÄúWhen you can‚Äôt fulfil your duties the way you‚Äôd like to, the way you normally would, it‚Äôs never ideal. [I‚Äôm] glad that Stokesy has been able to get his finger sorted and I saw some footage of him the other day back batting, so good signs. ‚ÄúAny team is more dangerous when you‚Äôve got someone like Ben Stokes playing. It certainly adds a lot to their depth, but we‚Äôre excited and I‚Äôm glad, personally, that he‚Äôs able to be back playing some cricket. It makes for a really good series.‚Äù It‚Äôs been a year of batting famine for Smith, who, after the home Test series against India, stepped away for more elbow rehab and a slow return to something near his best. Even now, Smith said, he was still on something of a batting diet - never more than two sessions on consecutive days. ‚ÄúI know a few months ago I was only allowed to bat for 10 minutes, and then it went to 15, 20 and I worked my way up to 45 minutes in the nets,‚Äù Smith said. ‚ÄúAt that point it was back, basically, to normal and I could carry on with my business. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm still taking it easy at the moment, just making sure I‚Äôm only batting two days in a row, not three days in a row, and I‚Äôll build up again as we get closer to playing some longer format stuff.‚Äù For now, Smith is playing a less conspicuous ‚Äúanchor‚Äù role in the Australian middle-order, either coming in to salvage the innings after early wickets or, as is yet to happen, being demoted below other power hitters, such as Marcus Stoinis, should Aaron Finch‚Äôs team make a strong start. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs essentially my role, I think I‚Äôve done it pretty well in the first couple of trial games and our first game against South Africa,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo I know what I need to do, the rest of the team knows my role, I think we‚Äôre all very clear on the way we all want to play, so that clarity‚Äôs there, it‚Äôs just about going and doing it. ‚ÄúSometimes you need an ability to be able to get off strike and manipulate the ball to certain areas, more than just the power. [On] some of these wickets even the powerful blokes have struggled to hit sixes, so you need some smarts about you in the middle and playing the situation and having the ability to limit dot balls and get off strike. ‚ÄúFor me that‚Äôs pretty simple but it depends who I‚Äôm batting with as well. It‚Äôs about batting in partnerships - if I‚Äôm batting with Glenn Maxwell, my job is to get him on strike and let him go about his business, and the same with some of the other stronger guys.‚Äù Looking ahead to the Ashes, where Smith‚Äôs wicket will be far less expendable, he expressed optimism that some extensive centre wicket sessions against Australia‚Äôs vaunted pace attack and focused mental preparation would steel him in ways previously derived from Sheffield Shield games. full_description: Darching ‚Äì Vier Punkte aus den ersten vier Spielen, das war die Vorgabe von J√ºrgen Primbs, dem Trainer der Volleyballerinnen der DJK Darching. Seine Mannschaft hat das umgesetzt. Am Samstag gewann die DJK ihr Heimspiel gegen den VC DJK M√ºnchen-Ost/Herrsching III mit 3:1 (14:25, 25:13, 26:24, 25:20) und holte so den ersten Saisonsieg. Die andere Partie verloren die Darchingerinnen zwar mit 0: 3 (23:25, 22:25, 18:25) gegen den TSV Gars. Auch hier √ºberzeugte die Darchinger Mannschaft aber mit viel Einsatz und √ºberraschte in den ersten beiden S√§tzen mit knappen Ergebnissen. Im Spiel gegen Gars startete die junge Regina Utz auf der Zuspieler-Position. ‚ÄûSie hat ihre Sache sehr gut gemacht‚Äú, lobt J√ºrgen Primbs. Seine Mannschaft zeigte anders als am ersten Wochenende kaum Ausschl√§ge nach oben oder unten. ‚ÄûDas Team hat relativ homogen gespielt‚Äú, sagt Primbs. ‚ÄûAktuell kann man im Angriff keine Spielerin herausheben. Das ist Schw√§che und St√§rke zugleich. Mal sehen, wie sich das entwickelt.‚Äú Auff√§llig sei aber, dass die DJK Darching mit schnellen B√§llen √ºber die Mitte wenig Gefahr verspr√ºht. ‚ÄûDa sind wir noch zu leicht auszurechnen‚Äú, sagt Primbs. Gegen den VC DJK M√ºnchen-Ost/Herrsching III lief mit Fini M√ºller die zweite junge Zuspielerin auf. ‚ÄûAuch sie hat gezeigt, warum wir in Zukunft auf sie bauen.‚Äú Im ersten Satz machte die DJK Darching noch zu viele Eigenfehler und punktete im Angriff zu selten. Doch die Mannschaft steigerte sich. Im zweiten Satz gab es zwei lange Aufschlagserien von Maria Kaiser und Marie Andr√§, die erfahrene Keppsi Huber verlieh der Mannschaft Stabilit√§t. Nur im dritten Satz machte es die DJK noch einmal spannend: Nach 24:19-Vorsprung hie√ü es auf einmal 24:24. ‚ÄûDa wollte die Mannschaft anscheinend noch ein wenig Nervenkitzel‚Äú, kommentiert Primbs. Doch Darching gewann mit 26:24, brachte auch den vierten Satz mit 25:20 nach Hause und fuhr den ersten Saisonsieg ein. Nach vier Spielen liegt die DJK nun auf dem f√ºnften Platz der Bezirksliga Ost. Allerdings hat dieser Rang wenig Aussagekraft, weil einige Mannschaften noch kein einziges Spiel absolviert haben. Nach dem n√§chsten Spieltag, den die DJK Darching Mitte November bestreitet, d√ºrfte schon eher klar sein, wo das Team steht.

Amelia Lorente n'avait, elle, pas √©t√© arr√™t√©e, car cette interdiction d'entrer en contact ne lui avait pas encore √©t√© notifi√©e formellement, et elle n'√©tait donc pas consid√©r√©e comme en tort. title: Lucknow and Ahmedabad: IPL 2022 to have 74 matches as 2 new teams added
creator: Ishka
description: IPL 2022 will feature 10 teamsLucknow and Ahmedabad are the latest teams to get added in IPLEach team will play 7 home and 7 away games
content: IPL 2022 to have 74 matches as 2 new teams addedIPL 2022 to have 74 matches as 2 new teams addedLucknow and Ahmedabad are the two new teams added to the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of the 2022 edition.As per the tender process, various interested parties submitted their bids for the new franchises. The bids were submitted by the authorised representatives of the interested parties in Dubai on Monday. The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) announced the following successful bidders: RPSG Ventures Ltd. - Lucknow (for INR 7,090 crores) and Irelia Company Pte Ltd (CVC Capital Partners) - Ahmedabad (for INR 5,625 crores). The participation of Lucknow and Ahmedabad is still subject to bidders completing the post-bid formalities as specified in the ITT document. The IPL 2022 season will comprise ten teams and will have 74 matches, wherein each team will play 7 home and 7 away matches, according to an official release from IPL. BCCI chief Sourav Ganguly welcomed the two teams and said that the high valuation of the franchises "reiterates the cricketing and financial strength of our cricket ecosystem." "The BCCI is happy to welcome two new teams from the next season of the Indian Premier League. I would like to congratulate RPSG Ventures Ltd. & Irelia Company Pte Ltd for being the successful bidders. The IPL will now go to two new cities in India viz in Lucknow and Ahmedabad. It is heartening to see the inclusion of two new teams at such a high valuation, and it reiterates the cricketing and financial strength of our cricket ecosystem. True to IPL's motto of 'Where Talent Meets Opportunity', the inclusion of two new teams will bring more domestic cricketers from our country to the global stage. The ITT process included two interested bidders from outside of India, which strongly emphasises the global appeal of the IPL as a sports property. The IPL is proving to be a wonderful instrument in globalising the game of cricket. I am keenly looking forward to IPL 2022," Ganguly was quoted in IPL's release, as saying. Meanwhile, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that with the two new teams added to the IPL, the BCCI will take the league to different parts of India. "It is a momentous day for all of us and I formally welcome RPSG Ventures Ltd. and Irelia Company Pte Ltd. into the IPL fold. We had promised that IPL will be bigger and better from the 15th season and with Lucknow and Ahmedabad, we will take the league to different parts of India. The IPL has established gold standards for leagues across the world and remains a premium event on the sporting calendar as it has grown rapidly in a short span. Despite numerous challenges posed by COVID-19, the 13th and 14th seasons were completed, and the bids prove that interested parties have faith in BCCI and its hosting capabilities. I am thrilled for the people of Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat as the long wait is over and they will now have their own IPL team. My best wishes to the two new teams," Jay Shah added. "The level of interest among the interested parties proves that IPL is among the most sought-after sporting leagues in the world. We had bids from different parts of the world and from parties with diverse portfolios wanting to make a foray into the world of sports. I extend my heartiest congratulations to RPSG Ventures Ltd. and Irelia Company Pte Ltd. for securing the rights to operate the two teams. We had a wonderful 14th season and the 2022 season will see a new beginning," IPL's chairman Brijesh Patel said.

title: Why this team wants nothing to do with all-time redemption after massive cheating scandal
description: For three days in May, New York‚Äôs Yankee Stadium was as loud as it had been since 2019, despite being limited to about 10,000 fans per night due to COVID protocols.
full_description: For three days in May, New York‚Äôs Yankee Stadium was as loud as it had been since 2019, despite being limited to about 10,000 fans per night due to COVID protocols. It was the Astros‚Äô first trip to The Bronx since their sign-stealing scandal during their World Series title season was exposed. Jose Altuve drew most of the attention on the night, hearing ‚ÄúF‚Äìk Altuve‚Äù while the rest of the team was subjected to ‚ÄúF‚Äìk the Astros‚Äù chants throughout the series. Watch live coverage of every game of the World Series with ESPN on Kayo. New to Kayo? Start Your Free Trial > ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôve seen that,‚Äô‚Äô Yankee manager Aaron Boone said at the time. ‚ÄúIt was definitely an energetic crowd. They expressed themselves.‚Äù Despite all that ‚Äî and their place in history forever tainted by garbage cans and video monitors in a scandal that cost A.J. Hinch his job as manager, Jeff Luhnow as general manager and caused bench coach Alex Cora to be suspended for a season and Carlos Beltran to lose the Mets managerial job ‚Äî Houston has a chance to change the narrative with a win in this World Series against the Braves. Just don‚Äôt mention any of it to the Astros. The Houston Astros celebrate after defeating the Boston Red Sox 5-0 in Game Six of the American League Championship Series. Source: Getty Images ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre playing here in the World Series because we‚Äôre motivated to go out there and prove people that we‚Äôre a really good team,‚Äô‚Äô Carlos Correa said Monday as the team prepared to play Game 1 of the World Series at Minute Maid Park. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre just here because we worked really hard from the moment we showed up to spring training because the loss last year, one win away from the World Series is bittersweet. And we just want to really show the world that we‚Äôre the best team out there. ‚Ä¶ In order for us to do that, we‚Äôve got to get four more wins.‚Äù The shortstop was more open about the situation in the aftermath of the Astros‚Äô ALCS win over the Red Sox, saying to the Washington Post: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs extra-special after everything we‚Äôve been through as a team, as a family. Our motivation is to show the world how great we really are.‚Äù They lost the ALCS a year ago, fell in the World Series in 2019 and the ALCS in 2018. In Dusty Baker‚Äôs second year at the helm, the Astros are back in the World Series for the third time in five seasons. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs their main source of motivation,‚Äô‚Äô Baker said of his players ‚Äî namely Correa, Altuve, Alex Bregman and Yuli Gurriel ‚Äî who were in Houston in 2017. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I think people are trying to make it as their main source of motivation, but that doesn‚Äôt motivate you nearly as much as just driving to win and driving for excellence. You can only be driven by ‚ÄòI‚Äôll show you,‚Äô or you can only be driven by negative motivation so far. I think this team is way past that because they know they can play.‚Äù They‚Äôve proven that with their success since ‚Äô17, even as suspicion surrounded their win two years later, when Altuve grabbed his jersey and told his teammates not to rip it off after hitting a walk-off homer in Game 6 of the 2019 ALCS against the Yankees. At the time, many believed Altuve was wearing a buzzer to help signal what pitch was coming, but an MLB investigation showed no evidence that was the case. Kendall Graveman #31 of the Houston Astros. Source: Getty Images Altuve said history wasn‚Äôt on his mind: ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt thought about that, but I think we have the same mindset we always have, just going out there and try to win.‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not worried about narratives,‚Äô‚Äô Bregman said. ‚ÄúI want to win four games. I want to play good baseball with this team, to be honest with you ‚Ä¶ the only thing on my mind is execution. That‚Äôs it. That‚Äôs what postseason winning baseball is all about is execution. Not any other stuff.‚Äô‚Äô Correa agreed. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think the outside noise motivates us at all,‚Äô‚Äô Correa said. ‚ÄúI just want to make sure that we do things right. We play baseball the right way, and we have fun doing it.‚Äù But Michael Brantley, who didn‚Äôt get to the Astros until 2019, said the reception of crowds outside Houston have toughened their skin. ‚ÄúWe get it everywhere we go,‚Äô‚Äô Brantley said. ‚ÄúWhat makes this team so special is we‚Äôve been here, done that. We‚Äôve been through all of it. There‚Äôs no stage that‚Äôs big enough. There‚Äôs nothing that a crowd is going to do to us that‚Äôs going to get us off our game.‚Äù SCHEDULE (all times AEDT) Game 1 at Houston: Wednesday October 27, 11am Game 2 at Houston: Thursday October 28, 11am Game 3 at Atlanta: Saturday October 30, 11am Game 4 at Atlanta: Sunday October 31, 11am Game 5 at Atlanta: Monday November 1: 11.15am Game 6 at Houston: Wednesday November 3 at 11am Game 7 at Houston: Thursday November 4 at 11am This originally appeared in NY Post and was republished with consent.

‚ÄòThere are some positives‚Äô: Thunder not panicking after third loss

title: ‚ÄòThere are some positives‚Äô: Thunder not panicking after third loss
creator: Sarah Keoghan
description: Last year‚Äôs WBBL champions are now sitting at the bottom of the ladder after a stunning bowling display from Kim Garth helped the Stars to victory.
full_description: Sydney Thunder coach Trevor Griffin is adamant his batting order will click sooner rather than later, with his defending champions now the only WBBL team yet to have a win this season. The Thunder slumped to their third defeat from four games on Tuesday after failing to chase the Melbourne Stars‚Äô modest target of 108. Opening batter Tahlia Wilson was removed for a duck on the third ball of the innings before youngster Phoebe Litchfield replaced her at the crease only to be dismissed for a golden duck. The less-than-ideal start knocked the wind out of the Thunder and despite an impressive 44 from Deepti Sharma, they could only limp to a total of 96 runs after their 20 overs. The defeat leaves the Thunder on the bottom of the WBBL ladder. The underwhelming batting performance was largely down to the bowling of Kim Garth, who finished her four overs with figures of 3-11. The Irish medium-pacer took three wickets for no runs in a blistering opening spell to leave the Thunder floundering at 4-12. Garth also sent down 19 dot balls - the most by a Stars player in an innings in WBBL history. The Sydney Thunder were handed another loss on Tuesday after failing to chase a modest 108 target set by the Melbourne Stars. Credit: Getty Despite his side‚Äôs collapse, Griffin is sticking strong with his batting order and said he would be working this week to instil more confidence in the top four. ‚ÄúWe need somebody in the top four to do the job, and the players understand that,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe review [our batting order] game by game and part of that depends on the situation, but from a combination point of view, I‚Äôm happy with what we‚Äôve got.‚Äù Griffin said he was confident his side would be able to bounce back quickly and find the form which took them to a premiership win last season. ‚ÄúThe vibe in the group is really good and positive. We‚Äôve just got to keep giving confidence and encouraging them to play their game,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúFrom a batting side of things, there are some positives. We‚Äôve only played three games. We just haven‚Äôt assessed the conditions and adjusted accordingly.‚Äù Sports news, results and expert commentary. Sign up for our Sport newsletter .

title: The last 4 times Chelsea led the PL after nine games‚Ä¶
creator: Planet Football
description: ‚Ä¶And what happened next. Mourinho is ‚Ä¶ The post The last 4 times Chelsea led the PL after nine games‚Ä¶ appeared first on Football365.
content: Chelsea have started the 2021-22 Premier League season on fire, topping the table after nine games ahead of Liverpool and Manchester City. Thomas Tuchel‚Äôs side won the Champions League in May and have carried that form into the new campaign, only suffering one defeat and scoring bagfuls of goals. We‚Äôve identified the four previous times Chelsea have led the table after nine matches and what happened next. Read the article at Planet Football. The post The last 4 times Chelsea led the PL after nine games‚Ä¶ appeared first on Football365.
full_description: Chelsea have started the 2021-22 Premier League season on fire, topping the table after nine games ahead of Liverpool and Manchester City . Thomas Tuchel‚Äôs side won the Champions League in May and have carried that form into the new campaign, only suffering one defeat and scoring bagfuls of goals. We‚Äôve identified the four previous times Chelsea have led the table after nine matches and what happened next. 2014-15 Bolstered by the signings of Diego Costa and Cesc Fabregas, Chelsea were the early pacesetters back in the autumn of 2014. Winning seven and drawing two of their first nine matches, Jose Mourinho‚Äôs side were the top goalscorers in the league and led second-placed Southampton by four points. They remained top of the rest throughout the season, only losing three times and winning the league by eight points. It‚Äôs the last time Mourinho has won a league title and, by December of the following season, he‚Äôd been sacked with Chelsea mired in an unlikely relegation battle. Andr√© Sch√ºrrle has today announced his retirement from football at just 29 years old. This was my favourite Chelsea Sch√ºrrle moment, an incredible combination with F√°bregas against Burnley. Mesmerising. pic.twitter.com/nmwNkSRiTt ‚Äî LDN (@LDNFootbalI) July 17, 2020 2012-13 After their improbable Champions League triumph the previous year, Roberto Di Matteo led Chelsea to the Premier League summit in 2012 ‚Äì although their ninth match would prove an unfavourable omen for the season ahead. Despite dropping points at QPR, Chelsea won their seven other matches before facing Manchester United at Stamford Bridge. In a controversial match, which saw Fernando Torres and Branislav Ivanovic dismissed, Javier Hernandez scored a late winner for United to close the gap on Chelsea to a single point. Di Matteo‚Äôs side surrendered top spot with a draw at Swansea in their next outing and never regained it. By the end of November, the manager was sacked and Rafa Benitez was bought in. Chelsea eventually finished third, 14 points behind United, but did manage to win the Europa League. 2010-11 Another year, another autumnal collapse. After nine games of the 2010-11 season, reigning champions Chelsea led the chasing pack by five points and had scored 25 goals in doing so. Then the wheels came off. Defeats against Liverpool, Sunderland (3-0 at home) and Birmingham stalled their momentum and failure to win at newly-promoted Newcastle saw Chelsea deposed as leaders by the end of November. Carlo Ancelotti‚Äôs side, after looking invincible during the late summer, now faced a struggle to finish in the top four. Only a string of victories in March and April saved their league season and they eventually finished second ‚Äì nine points behind Manchester United. Ancelotti was infamously sacked minutes after the final league game and Chelsea would have to wait another four years to regain the title. Chelsea hadn't conceded a Premier League goal at Stamford Bridge for nine games before Nedum Onuoha's rocked up with Sunderland in November 2010 and turned into George Best. Happy birthday to the former #MCFC , #SAFC & #QPR defenderüéÇüéâ pic.twitter.com/3SrDnCcD4U ‚Äî Planet Football (@planetfutebol) November 12, 2020 2005-06 Before Mourinho arrived in English football, teams would ease into the new season and not worry about dropped points too much. Sir Alex Ferguson was famous for simply requiring his side were in touch with the leaders before Christmas before blitzing them in the new year. Mourinho‚Äôs Chelsea changed all that. After acquiring 95 points the year before, Chelsea won all of their first nine matches and opened up a massive gap to second-placed Tottenham. Fergie‚Äôs United were 10 points behind the leaders. Chelsea would drop their first points in their 10th match, a 1-1 draw at Everton, but were never displaced as league leaders and won the title by thrashing United in late April. Only defeats in their final two matches stopped Chelsea from eclipsing the previous season‚Äôs points tally and they ended up eight points out in front. title: Veronica geeft H√©l√®ne Hendriks voetbalshow, rol Kees Jansma
description: H√©l√®ne Hendriks (41) gaat een wekelijkse voetbalshow presenteren op Veronica. Eigenaar Talpa heeft de komst van 'The Bettle' aangekondigd, waarin er iedere week twee teams onder leiding van teamcaptains Frank Lammers en Leo Alkemade zo veel mogelijk voetbalvragen goed moeten beantwoorden om uiteindelijk het finalespel te kunnen winnen.
full_description: 9:22 ‚Äì H√©l√®ne Hendriks (41) gaat een wekelijkse voetbalshow presenteren op Veronica. Eigenaar Talpa heeft de komst van 'The Bettle' aangekondigd, waarin er iedere week twee teams onder leiding van teamcaptains Frank Lammers en Leo Alkemade zo veel mogelijk voetbalvragen goed moeten beantwoorden om uiteindelijk het finalespel te kunnen winnen. Vanaf 5 november 2021 is de voetbalquiz te zien op Veronica na de voetbaltalkshow Veronica Inside om 22.00 uur op de vrijdagavonden. Naast de voetbalvragen doen Lammers en Alkemade elke week ook een voorspelling over het verloop van het komende voetbalweekend. Er wordt tijdens de show gespeeld in vijf speelrondes met verschillende voetbalvragen en opdrachten, waarin punten en gouden ballen te verdienen zijn. In de finaleronde wordt in 'The Bettle Box' gespeeld tussen een teamlid van beide groepen, die de gouden bal moet schieten tegen een van de zestien oplichtende vlakkende. Het team dat de meeste vlakken raakt, wint het tv-programma. Lees ook : Dagelijkse talkshow Derksen, Genee en Gijp een feit Er is ook een rolletje weggelegd voor journalist Kees Jansma, ge√Øntroduceerd als 'het voetbalgeweten van Nederland'. De voormalige perschef van het Nederlands elftal fungeert als scheidsrechter bij de voetbalquiz. Het programma wordt geproduceerd door Southfields.

content: Cleveland Cavaliers forward Lauri Markkanen performs a monster dunk on MVP Nikola Jokic. The Finland native talks about Kobe Bryant being his favorite hooper, remembering the Black Mamba‚Äôs iconic 81-point game. The Cleveland Cavaliers have been a lottery team ever since LeBron James left in 2018. The team has been in the news lately for its tumultuous relationship with its five-time All-Star Kevin Love. The former champion was recently replaced in the starting lineup by rookie Evan Mobley. However, Love has embraced his new role and has nothing but praise for the 20-year old Mobley. Nonetheless, the Cavs fans had something to cheer about today with their team defeating the Denver Nuggets. However, the highlight of the game consisted of newly acquired Lauri Markkanen dunk over MVP Nikola Jokic. The play involved Markkanen intercepting a Jokic pass and would follow it up by posterizing the former MVP. The seven-foot Cavs forward had everyone‚Äôs attention with that play. Also read: ‚ÄúTacko Fall at ‚Äòpoint guard‚Äô would mean an 82-0 season‚Äù: Jarrett Allen hilariously mocks the Cavaliers for having too many big-men following Lauri Markkanen trade Markkanen told Scoop B Radio that Kobe Bryant was his all-time favorite player. The 20-year old recalled the iconic 81-point game the Lakers legend had against the Toronto Raptors. Twitter reacts to Lauri Markkanen‚Äôs dunk on reigning MVP Nikola Jokic. The Cavs defeated the Nuggets 99-87. However, Markkanen‚Äôs dunk had the social media buzzing more than Cavs‚Äô win over Nuggets. LAURI MARKKANEN POSTERIZED JOKIC. Stared down MVP. pic.twitter.com/1hDRh6LWDc ‚Äî House of Highlights (@HoHighlights) October 26, 2021 Ouch. I was waiting for some fake ass post but that my friends is an authentic 100% real poster ‚Äî Jesy (@TheJesseMessy) October 26, 2021 That‚Äôs tuff ‚Äî Big Honey Stan Account (@jgives99) October 26, 2021 Lauri Markkanen is an ardent Kobe Bryant fan. Markkanen, who has been trending on social media for his dunk on Jokic, had recently spoken about his all-time favorite NBA player to Scoop B Radio. The Finland native would reminiscence the Mamba‚Äôs 81-point game. ‚ÄúI remember he shot like 3 threes in a row against the Toronto Raptors and tied the game to go to the overtime,‚Äù he told Scoop B Radio. ‚ÄúI watched the 81 point games.‚Äù Also read: ‚ÄúDamian Lillard likes image that places Ben Simmons in Portland‚Äù: Blazers superstar sends NBA fans into a frenzy amidst Sixers DPOY trade rumors The late Kobe Bryant has had a huge impact on the current generation of NBA stars. title: Var, caos in Serie A: ma quale "domenica ottima", ecco perch√© il regolamento non funziona
creator: Tommaso Lorenzini
description: ¬´Non ci tiriamo indietro di fronte a eventuali errori e i ragazzi hanno disputato una giornata ottima: se ci sono partite bellissime il merito √® anche nostro¬ª. E pazienza se nella stessa domenica di grazia vengono espulsi Spalletti (¬´Massa non ha capito la battuta, ma ha reagito come volevamo¬ª esclama Rocchi), Mou, Inzaghi e Gasperini da ¬´ragazzini a cui neanche si pu√≤ controbattere¬ª (Gasp dixit): pi√π che pugno di ferro, pare un modo comodo per liberarsi di un rompiscatole mascherando nervi fragili. Al designatore della Can, Gianluca Rocchi (un fine umorista?), pare andare bene cos√¨, lo conferma a RadioUno, spiegando che il Var ¬´√® da oliare e avr√† tanto sviluppo; ha portato grandi benefici, pi√π giustizia, gli errori sul fuorigioco sono stati eliminati. Voglio per√≤ che ci siano arbitri che decidano in campo¬ª.¬† ¬† Ma cos√¨ non √®, e cos√¨ non Var. Che siano navigati direttori di gara o giovanotti da formare, gli arbitri non tolgono l'elmetto e mettono la testa sotto la sabbia. Rocchi sorvola sul fatto che nella stessa ¬´ottima giornata¬ª le partite clou, Roma-Napoli e Inter-Juve, abbiano offerto interpretazioni opposte di uno stesso regolamento che:¬† 1) o non √® scritto bene e allora va aggiustato;¬† 2) √® scritto volutamente in modo tale che la discrezionalit√† sopravviva. Ma se fosse cos√¨, addio uniformit√†.¬† I CASI INCRIMINATI Roma-Napoli: Cristante mette i tacchetti sul polpaccio destro di Anguissa che sta rincorrendo il pallone in area. L'arbitro Massa decide che non √® rigore e il Var non lo richiama: non viene neanche suggerita la revisione, n√© compare in tv la consueta sovraimpressione "penalty check in corso" (il Var non fiata neanche sulla possibile espulsione di Abraham per una scarpata in faccia Zielinski e sull'intervenyto di Rui Patricio anticipato da Osimhen vicino alla porta). Inter-Juve: rigore dell'1-1 concesso ai bianconeri. L'arbitro Mariani √® vicino all'azione quando avviene il contatto Dumfries-Alex Sandro e fa proseguire con ampi gesti: ha visto, non c'√® fallo. Dopo qualche minuto interviene il Var, richiama Mariani che va a rivedere l'azione e d√† rigore. Il tocco di Dumfries √® lieve, ma c'√®: ecco che il protocollo Var viene applicato in maniera opposta rispetto a Roma.¬† ¬† Chi ha ragione? Dovrebbero dircelo gli arbitri, ma non lo fanno; dovrebbe farlo il regolamento, ma abbiamo tutti capito che la norma per cui il Var pu√≤ assistere l'arbitro solo in caso di ¬´chiaro ed evidente errore¬ª o ¬´grave episodio non visto¬ª pu√≤ voler dire tutto e niente. Magari tra qualche mese usciranno interviste riparatrici: l'ha fatto Orsato sul caso Pjanic (mancato secondo giallo dopo fallo su Rafinha in Inter-Juve), l'ha fatto Calvarese su Cuadrado (rigore per i bianconeri quando invece √® il colombiano a buttarsi fra le gambe di Perisic, durante Juve-Inter). Il nuovo corso comunicativo inaugurato dal presidente Alfredo Trentalange √® ectoplasmatico, non si sa quali confini abbia e non √® al passo coi tempi. Gli arbitri non hanno una struttura mediatica per fornire spiegazioni tempestive delle decisioni controverse, regolamento alla mano. Che dovrebbero conoscere, anche se la battuta di Orsato a Cristante nell'intervallo di Juve-Roma (¬´Il vantaggio sul rigore non si d√† mai. E se non fischio? Poi dai la colpa a me perch√© l'ha sbagliato¬ª), non solo non √® riuscita, ma ha pure svelato che molti fischietti avrebbero bisogno di un ripassino. ¬†

content: WWE star Carmella believes she‚Äôll never get ‚Äòrespect‚Äô in the industry because of her looks. She said: ‚ÄúGood luck, because when you‚Äôre pretty, that doesn‚Äôt happen. ‚ÄúThat fires me up, it really does. I get so upset when I hear something like that, Because (Mandy) is pretty, and she‚Äôs a babe, and she has a great body then she can‚Äôt be good in the ring. description: Per la sfida contro la Fiorentina, Maurizio Sarri recupera i due difensori centrali Acerbi e Luiz Felipe. Nuova panchina in...
content: Impegno infrasettimanale all'Olimpico per la Lazio, che mercoled√¨ 27 ottobre ospiter√† la Fiorentina di Italiano. La squadra biancoceleste dopo la sconfitta contro il Verona √® in ritiro a Formello per preparare la sfida...
full_description: Impegno infrasettimanale all'Olimpico per la Lazio, che mercoled√¨ 27 ottobre ospiter√† la Fiorentina di Italiano. La squadra biancoceleste dopo la sconfitta contro il Verona √® in ritiro a Formello per preparare la sfida contro la Viola. Per il turno infrasettimanale Maurizio Sarri avr√† a disposizione Luiz Felipe e Francesco Acerbi. Dimenticare Verona, √® l'obiettivo della Lazio. Per farlo, contro la Fiorentina, Maurizio Sarri ripartir√† da Acerbi e Luiz Felipe. I due difensori al rientro dalle rispettive squalifiche, torneranno a guidare la difesa biancoceleste davanti a Reina. Terzini saranno Hysaj e Marusic, pi√π indietro Lazzari. A centrocampo conferma per Milinkovic-Savic mentre Basic e Cataldi sono pronti a rilevare Akpa Akpro e Leiva. Altra panchina in arrivo per Luis Alberto . Davanti non si toccano Immobile, Felipe Anderson e Pedro. Out Zaccagni per infortunio, per lui si tratta di una distorsione al ginocchio che lo terr√† fuori fra le tre e le quattro settimane. La Fiorentina arriva all'Olimpico, dopo la travolgente vittoria contro il Cagliari. Italiano per la partita contro la Lazio non recupera Dragowski, Pulgar e Kokorin. In porta ci sar√† Terracciano, mentre Odriozola √® in recupero su Venuti. A completare la difesa ci saranno Biraghi, Milenkovic e Quarta. Centrocampo torna titolare Duncan, confermati Bonaventura e Torreira in regia. Torna in panchina Castrovilli. In attacco intoccabili Vlahovic, Nico Gonzalez. Per l'ultimo posto √® corsa a tre fra Saponara (favorito), Callejon e Sottil. Lazio (4-3-3): Reina; Marusic, Acerbi, Luiz Felipe, Hysaj; Cataldi, Milinkovic-Savic, Basic; Felipe Anderson, Pedro, Immobile. Allenatore: Sarri. Fiorentina (4-3-3): Terracciano; Odriozola, Milenkovic, Quarta, Biraghi; Bonaventura, Torreira, Duncan; Saponara, Gonzalez, Vlahovic. Allenatore: Italiano. La partita Lazio-Fiorentina sar√† trasmessa in esclusiva su Dazn. Gli abbonati potranno vedere la sfida fra biancocelesti e viola sull'app su dispositivi mobili, smart tv oppure collegandosi a console come Xbox o Playstation. In alternativa collegandosi tramite TIMVISION BOX o ad un dispositivo Amazon Fire TV Stick o Google Chromecast.

title: Paul Warhurst: From jobbing centre-half to lethal striker
creator: Planet Football
description: An ode to a Sheff Weds ‚Ä¶ The post Paul Warhurst: From jobbing centre-half to lethal striker appeared first on Football365.
content: In the early season of 1992-93 Paul Warhurst was living a fairly unremarkable career as a professional footballer. After earning England Under-21 caps with Oldham, he‚Äôd moved to Sheffield Wednesday and carved out a reputation as a solid, if unspectacular Premier League central defender. Wednesday, under the guidance of manager Trevor Francis, were a decent attacking outfit. John Sheridan played champagne passes across the middle of the park, Chris Waddle was still one of the best players in the league, and David Hirst‚Äôs left foot was capable of extraordinary acts of violence. Nobody noticed the defence. And certainly nobody noticed Warhurst. In an age where Sky‚Äôs hullabaloo meant footballers were slowly becoming household names, Wednesday‚Äôs dependable centre-half was still effectively Mr Nobody. Read the article at Planet Football. Nobody noticed the defence. And certainly nobody noticed Warhurst. In an age where Sky‚Äôs hullabaloo meant footballers were slowly becoming household names, Wednesday‚Äôs dependable centre-half was still effectively Mr Nobody. Read the article at Planet Football. The post Paul Warhurst: From jobbing centre-half to lethal striker appeared first on Football365.
full_description: In the early season of 1992-93 Paul Warhurst was living a fairly unremarkable career as a professional footballer. After earning England Under-21 caps with Oldham, he‚Äôd moved to Sheffield Wednesday and carved out a reputation as a solid, if unspectacular Premier League central defender. Wednesday, under the guidance of manager Trevor Francis, were a decent attacking outfit. John Sheridan played champagne passes across the middle of the park, Chris Waddle was still one of the best players in the league, and David Hirst‚Äôs left foot was capable of extraordinary acts of violence. Nobody noticed the defence. And certainly nobody noticed Warhurst. In an age where Sky‚Äôs hullabaloo meant footballers were slowly becoming household names, Wednesday‚Äôs dependable centre-half was still effectively Mr Nobody. He‚Äôd played 37 games without scoring in his debut season at Hillsborough, whilst his team-mates grabbed all the headlines. Kids in Sheffield were re-enacting Waddle‚Äôs wing wizardry, or hammering shots like Hirst. There wasn‚Äôt much playground kudos for quietly ushering a ball out of play like Warhurst. Then in September 1992, an injury crisis left Trevor Francis in desperate need of strikers. Against all odds, he took a punt on Warhurst, hoping his speed would complement Mark Bright‚Äôs aerial prowess. The makeshift forward notched in his first game, before grabbing three more goals over two legs of the UEFA Cup tie with Spora Luxembourg. This said more about the standard of the opposition than anything else. I‚Äôm not saying Spora Luxembourg were shit, but you could have probably stuck Roy Hattersley up top and you‚Äôd fancy him to nick a goal. ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ READ: Benito Carbone: Sheffield Wednesday are in my heart and I dream of return ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ When David Hirst returned to fitness, the fun little experiment seemed over. Warhurst happily returned to the anonymity of the back four ‚Äì until more injuries in January meant Francis came knocking at his door again. Only this time it was different. Very different. Overnight, Warhurst turned into the most lethal centre-forward in the country. He embarked on an extraordinary run of 12 goals in 12 games, propelling Wednesday up the league and into two domestic cup finals. It wasn‚Äôt just the quantity of goals that was catching the eye. It was the quality. He was tearing past defenders at will, hitting the top corner with both feet, and powering back post headers into the net. To put this into modern-day context, this would be like Wolves chucking shot-shy Conor Coady up top and watching him morph into Cristiano Ronaldo. Even Skynet couldn‚Äôt manufacture a striker as fucking magnificent as this. He was a machine. He couldn‚Äôt be reasoned with. He couldn‚Äôt be bargained with. He didn‚Äôt feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And he certainly wasn‚Äôt going to go back to playing the offside trap with Nigel Pearson. He was outscoring the likes of Ian Wright, Les Ferdinand and Teddy Sheringham. His incredible form was rewarded with a call-up to Graham Taylor‚Äôs England squad. Within the space of three months, he‚Äôd gone from jobbing centre-back to a potential England No.9. üìÜ #OTD in 1993 üèÜ FA Cup Quarter Finals ü¶â @SWFC 1-0 @DCFCOfficial üëä Paul Warhurst booked The Owls their place in the semi-finals when he latched onto a superb cross by John Sheridan pic.twitter.com/J7jCsr6BZK ‚Äî Emirates FA Cup (@EmiratesFACup) March 17, 2019 His manager didn‚Äôt quite know what to make of it all. Hardly a risk-taker, was Trevor Francis. He had the air of a man who‚Äôd spent a lifetime quietly lobbying for champagne corks to be replaced with ring pulls. He was also the genius who famously rejected Eric Cantona a year earlier when he had the chance to sign the Frenchman on a free transfer. Hindsight makes fools of us all, but it takes a special judge of a player to turn down the most important player in Premier League history because you thought Nigel Jemson would win more flick-ons. All of which probably explains why Warhurst was jettisoned in favour of David Hirst for the FA Cup Final with Arsenal. In fairness to Francis, another injury crisis (training at Sheffield Wednesday in this era seemed more dangerous to your health than enlisting with the SAS) meant they were short at the back and his multi-talented star was needed there. The relationship between player and manager soured. Warhurst moved to Blackburn the following season, but two catastrophic leg breaks meant he never regained that sparkling form of 1993 and he eventually reinvented himself again as a holding midfielder. Nonetheless, his story was an inspiration to us all. There were still fairytales in football. From unassuming stopper to unstoppable striker. For a few weeks in 1993, Paul Warhurst lived the dream. Sid Lambert has teamed up with Quickly Kevin host Chris Scull to author Can We Not Knock It? A Celebration of 90s Football. From Ceefax to Subbuteo. From Des Lynam to Diana Ross‚Äôs penalty technique. It‚Äôs a tribute to the niche and the nonsense of the 90s. This article is an extract from the book, which you can pre-order here . Wolff: ‚ÄòHistory has no relevance‚Äô in title fight
creator: Jon Wilde
description: Toto Wolff believes results in past years of the F1 races still to come are irrelevant to this season's World Championship battle. The post Wolff: ‚ÄòHistory has no relevance‚Äô in title fight appeared first on PlanetF1.
content: Toto Wolff thinks Formula 1‚Äôs historical form book offers no guide to how this year‚Äôs enthralling World Championship battle will be decided. Both titles remain very much up for grabs with Max Verstappen leading Lewis Hamilton by 12 points in the Drivers‚Äô standings, while Mercedes are 23 ahead of Red Bull in the Constructors‚Äô heading into the final five races. Two of those grands prix, in Qatar and Saudi Arabia, are at entirely new venues for Formula 1 and therefore it is impossible to know which team will prove to be the faster there. Mexico, Brazil and Abu Dhabi provide more in the way of clues from previous editions, with Red Bull entitled to feel confident about the first two of those in particular based on past results. But Wolff believes the form book may as well be tossed out of the window given how some of this season‚Äôs races have turned out, not least in Austin where Red Bull achieved a one-three finish at what had previously been a Mercedes stronghold. Brilliant racing and strategic battle This is why we F1! #USGP 17 down, 5 to go. pic.twitter.com/PTU6ZjojUw ‚Äî Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS F1 Team (@MercedesAMGF1) October 25, 2021 ‚ÄúMexico was traditionally a track that was difficult for us, but this season everything can change,‚Äù the Mercedes team principal told Sky Sports F1. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen where traditionally our strong ones and they haven‚Äôt [been] and vice versa, so I really think it‚Äôs race by race. ‚ÄúI think we‚Äôve had tough fights with Ferrari in 2018 and ‚Äô19 and we won seven [titles] in a row, but that is no comfort whilst you are in a championship that‚Äôs hard. ‚ÄúHistory has no relevance ‚Äì only if you stop one day you can look at the stats that don‚Äôt interest anybody anyway.‚Äù Seeing Verstappen take the chequered flag in Austin was undoubtedly a setback for Wolff, especially with Hamilton potentially needing to take more new power-unit parts that would incur another grid penalty ‚Äì possibly even next time out in Mexico. His team-mate, Valtteri Bottas, has had to serve such penalties at three of the last four races. ¬† However, in the face of the biggest threat to his team‚Äôs dominance since their title-winning run began, Wolff insisted he is embracing the challenge and remaining upbeat that Mercedes can find a way to hold on to both of their crowns. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard but we have fun, we are enjoying it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI think the morale is high. We arrive there [thinking] we can win every race and it‚Äôs about avoiding the DNFs, they are the killers. ‚ÄúTherefore, we are taking this grid penalty with the engines [with Bottas] but it‚Äôs just good fun for everybody. There is pressure, but it‚Äôs positive pressure.‚Äù ¬† ¬† The post Wolff: ‚ÄòHistory has no relevance‚Äô in title fight appeared first on PlanetF1.
